description:
Their apple fritters are really good. They are actually normal sized unlike some other donut shops which is nice. I base my appreciation for donut shops on their apple fritters. Twisted gets my seal of approval!

I've been here on multiple occasions and I've liked most of their items. It's never too crowded there but it seems like the majority of people really like their stuff. 

The lady there is really nice and they have weekend specials. I had some of the cream puffs Sunday, and they were delicious!
author: Gordon L.

description:
While all the donuts look great, they didn't taste very good at all. I tried the donut holes and guava coconut and the donut is dry. I couldn't even taste the guava. I tried the cruller with orange on top. Again the cruller was dry and hard. Crullers are supposed to be soft, moist, and a bit airy/fluffy inside. This cruller wasn't like that at all. 

The prices was way too much for something not that good. And the Chinese woman helping me was so rude!

Something has changed....

The Donuts here are smaller and generic tasting now. 

Perhaps this is a one off but I have probably had donuts here 8-10 times and they use to have amazing flavor. Now I couldn't find a single one that had good flavor.
author: David G.

description:
This donut spot is literally down the street from my house. So dangerous, but also so convenient for all the adult brunch gatherings that I am looking forward to in my near future. They have interesting donut flavors, but I agree with my friends that the real (and only) winner is the maple bacon donut. I'm also a fan of their savory croissants, of which I have tried the jalapeno, cheddar, and ham. I think it would be even better if they offered to heat up the croissants prior to serving! 

Their coffee isn't anything spectacular. Don't expect locally roasted beans or made to order drip coffee, but if all you need is a cup of joe to wake yourself up with, this will do. I like that they serve their iced coffee with coffee ice cubes. This is a huge plus for people like me who take forever to drink their coffee and always end up with a melted, messy puddle of watered-down coffee at the end of the morning.
author: Sherry L.

description: Great donut place in San Francisco that offers donuts without peanuts for kids with peanut allergies. I wish they made better coffee so it can be a one stop shop place for morning donuts and coffee. I second that on the excellent apple fritters.
author: Gerald H.

description:
I came to Twisted Donuts once and bought a dozen to treat my coworkers but didn't get a chance to have one myself. I didn't think too much of it cause I had originally chosen Twisted since it was open early and near my home. But after multiple coworkers stopped by my desk to tell me just how good it was, I was definitely feeling left out!

Fast forward a month and I decided it was about time to bring in treats again to ruin everyone's new years resolutions once and for all...

*insert evil laughter here*

Again, when I walked in at 6:15am, I was greeted by the nicest lady who also immediately recognized that I was Chinese and wished me a Happy Lunar New Year. I asked her to pick a dozen for me like last time and she had me ready to go in minutes.

At work, I grabbed myself a brown sugar dusted donut and found it to be perfectly fluffy and not oily in the slightest. It had just the right amount of chew in my opinion. They may not have the looks of Dynamo or other hipster joints, but they certainly make a killer neighboorhood coffee shop donut like no other!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Anyone who reads my reviews knows the roommate and I have a doughnut problem. A few weeks ago, I was craving donuts yet again. Decided to order breakfast / snack delivery on Sunday, December 31st at 11:46am. Our order arrived via DoorDash at 12:58pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Croissants: Plain ($2.25)
*Twist ($1.75)
*Jelly Filled: Blueberry, Choco Bavarian, Lemon ($1.50 each)
*Apple Fritter ($2)
*French Cruller ($1.75)
*Old Fashioned ($1.40)

I liked the jelly filled donuts the best. They were fluffy and not too sweet. Although I was disappointed as I really wanted the Choco Bavarian one and they gave me what I think was a Chocolate Buttermilk Bar instead. I'm not into cakey donuts, so this was a bummer. Plus, custard filled are my fav, so it did suck that I didn't get the one donut I really wanted. The other donuts were pretty good. The apple fritter was doughy with a slight crispiness on the outside. The twist, light and fluffy. The croissant was a little dense. Almost like eating bread. Felt like it needed more butter and layers maybe? They didn't have a french cruller, so DoorDash ended up crediting me $2.09 on my card. Not a big deal, as I could have done with or without it.

Pretty good donuts, but they should have told me they didn't have the Choco Bavarian instead of replacing it. That was basically my whole reason for getting donuts from here! Subtracting a star from what would have been a four star review!
author: Elena N.

description:
We worked with Twisted for our wedding to have a donut bar. They allow you to customize donuts and are very friendly and accommodating! Highly recommend! 

They can make letter shaped donuts, any color icing and you can even send your own sprinkles to make whatever decorations you want. They really do want you to enjoy your donuts! If you can think of it, they're going to do everything they can to help you get it in a donut form! 

Prices were more than reasonable and very competitive compared to the other donut shops in town. We picked twisted because they were prompt with their communication and were open to customizing to meet our needs/wants.
author: Lilee N.

description:
I came here with a friend as it was just across the street from Home (popular coffee spot) and we were pleasantly surprised when sharing a delicious, fresh, sprinkled donut! The small donuts were $1.25 not bad for pricy SF! 

We could tell it was family owned because a sweet, grandma let us know sitting right next to us. She said it was her son's restaurant, and I truly liked supporting a local business. It's rare that I would purchase a donut but this was good and if in the area I would recommend it. They had some maple bacon ones that looked sinfully good!
author: Priya S.

description: The guava coconut donut I had was incredible in flavor. It was so unique. It was a little more spongy in texture than I expected but the flavor was awesome. Definitely would go back to try more.
author: Katie C.

description:
Deliciously light donuts just like I the ones I had when I was younger. 

When I was a child my dad would take me to the public library. He would read the paper while I read as many books my little heart desired. 

Afterward, we would walk around the corner to a pink box bakery to get a buttermilk bar and coffee for my dad  and a maple cake with sprinkles and a hot cocoa for me. While we enjoyed our treat I would tell my dad about the books I read while he listened. 

Coming from a large family, quality one on one time with my dad was really special. 

The donuts here remind me of that. They are not fancy hipster overpriced nonsense. No. These are the donuts of everyone's childhood. 

They are wonderfully light, perfectly sweetened, and ridiculously delicious. 

Raised, old fashioned, twists, bars, holes, fritters, and cake. Yes, donuts from my childhood. 

I wrote this on Fathers Day. Thinking of my dad who passed away and how I still remember his positive influences in my life in every day ways.  

I love this place. I hope you do too. 

Support your local mom and pop. Have a donut and a cup of coffee. It won't be overpriced nonsense. Sometimes that is just what we need.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Ate the bacon peno donut. 
Made me wonder, how does this place have 4.5 stars? 
4.5 stars tell me that a place is superb
The donut I tried was very standard. 
A solid but standard donut. 
Average.
Guess for the price and the yelp reviews, I was expecting something a little bit more unusual and unique.
author: J P.

description:
TL;DR Yummy donuts + friendly staff, support local businesses!!

I came here 15 minutes before they closed, so they only had 4 varieties of donuts left. I shared the maple donut ($1) with a friend. It was exactly what you'd imagine a maple donut to be. It also had the perfect texture & sweetness. My friend wanted to get an old fashion donut, but they were out I'd say the maple donut was good, and not stale even though it was closing. I've noticed that staff usually get annoyed when customers come in during closing, but the staff who got us our donut was super welcoming and friendly. If I'm in the area, I'd definitely come here again for donuts!
author: Sophia L.

description:
There were a few different unique items i never heard of. I got one of the folding pastries that looks like an envelope with a filling. You could get blueberry or raspberry when i went but i hear there are other flavors usually. The jam filling in mine was verry very sweet so be aware of that. I have a sweet tooth but this level of sugar was really high. They were sold out of a few items but some sounded very interesting like the bacon jalapeno maple donut. I would've like to try one of those. I believe they also had other items listed on the board that I briefly skimmed and I believe sandwiches were on there.

Staff were friendly but they were definitely expecting us to buy at least one thing as soon as we walked in. Not much seating excepty several small tables so probably best to get items To-Go here.
author: Laura Y.

description:
I had to leave home early morning to run an errand, and when that was done I got hungry and wanted to do something nice for my wife who cooked me an omelet the day before.

So what place is open as early as 6 am during the week, and 7 am Sat/Sun? Twisted Donuts of course! 

There's a lot of parking in front of this hole-in-the-wall shop, and if you get there early, it's free!

So what about the shop? First of all, let me tell you that customer service at this place is second to none! I haven't seen the husband, but the wife is so friendly! She'll treat you with respect and patience with a smile on her face.

I appreciate that they have cardboard boxes, to avoid the usual mess of paper bags, so everything looks as nice at home as it did in the shop, without sticky donut bottoms and smashed corners.

My wife and I liked the donuts, we had the orange, vanilla, warrior (blue with a "W" on it), and a bar with chocolate on top. The donuts mostly come in the perfect size, not too big and not too small. In other shops they're often too big for my taste, so I only get one. But with this size, I could sample a few different ones.

It was quite a surprise to read online that they've only been in business since 2014, because it feels like they've known their craft for 25.
author: Matthew C.

description: The lady working (possibly the owner) was so friendly and helpful giving us recommendations. We ordered 6 donuts between 2 of us and devoured them all within about 10 minuets, ooups.
author: Sean P.

description: For a donut shop, they do give excellent service.  I come here normally to find their french cruller donut, but i've tried a few other donuts.  They do sell out early and when that happens they close up shop.   It's not a bad place to come hang out with friends , they do have a few tables.  They also take card which is a place and their donuts are always fresh!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Fuuuuuck, dude. Come through here for amazing donuts. Forget Krispy Kreme and Dunkin' Donuts. Sorry, but trust me. It's worth it to support this little neighborhood donut shop. 

My boyfriend and I took a trip here on a Saturday afternoon after having some coffee and snacks at HOME, across the street. Parking isn't exactly the best, especially on the weekend so it could take a while for you to look for a spot. All spots on the street are metered and enforced Mon-Sat til 6pm so so keep your eyes peeled. 

Twisted Donuts have been in my bookmarks for so long, but I've never been until this weekend because either I'm too far from it OR when I'm in the area it's at a late time and I feel like they wouldn't have anymore donuts left so yeah, glad this weekend allowed me the time to come through because I have zero regrets. 

We ended up only getting two donuts to try, their old fashioned blueberry one and the maple bacon. We didn't consume the donuts till a much later time and I was pleasantly surprised that both donuts were still soft and delicious as it would've been if we had gotten it fresh. Usually old fashioned donuts are a bit thick and chewy, but their version was light and airy. Not dense at all. And the maple bacon one was perfect sweet/salty combo. Both are total winners.

Service was also very friendly. The mother/daughter combo that was working on Saturday were willing to engage in small chit chat and welcomed us into their store when we told them it was our first time. 

Overall, come back yes.
author: Venus L.

description:
THIS place right here. THIS PLACE is special. Not only are the donuts beautiful and delicious, the service friendly (as if you were at home in someone else's house), and the smell - scrumptious, the PRICE is ridiculously affordable.

I grab a donut at some other coffee shop and I'm expecting to pay at least $4.50. Call me an oblivious San Franciscan but it is the way it is. I was shocked when our little sprinkled get was only $1.50!!! I mean - I'll take a bakers dozen... x2. Thanks.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Found this little gem while visiting the city and having lattes across the street at Home ! The owner was sooooo nice !! We got an assortment of donuts - maple bacon, chocolate butter butter, cinnamon twist, some cream puffs, maple old fashioned and maple with pecans and a something a little new fruititto !!! This was basically two tortilla, stuffed with apples an berries coated in sugar and fried - wowza !!!
All were super fresh and super delicious !!
author: Shahna G.

description:
Twisted Donuts is a friendly-staffed little hole-in-the-wall shop with cheap prices and fresh pastry. I don't know what they do to them, but their donuts taste great even well into the late afternoon. 

It certainly isn't frilly and the coffee is self-serve and flavored but it certainly works in a pinch if you're not picky and they have plenty of different types of milks and creamers in the fridge for you to dilute it with. 

I can's speak for the novelty donuts because I don't get those, but I can say that their classics are solid. Who doesn't love big donuts at low prices? There's plenty of surrounding eateries as well so this would make for a sweet and simple little dessert stop after dinner or drinks with friends and family and can easily double as quick breakfast if you work nearby.
author: Lucia K.

description: I saw cream puff on their board on the sidewalk. I was on the way to the bus. So I decided to stop by this Saturday morning for a cream puff. They are mini(not that large) and .75. The nice owner lady asked me how many I wanted...haha I only wanted to try one. It was filled with a whipped cream like substance. They could try filling it with vanilla custard or putting a chocolate coating on top of it. They sprinkled powdered sugar on it. I think it was nice. It's awesome that they try new things because that's vital. Here's to mini cream puffs at Twisted.
author: Denise C.

description:
I have visited Twisted Donuts and Coffee quite a few times as it's in my neighborhood.  Their donuts are pretty good, always fresh and light, never oily.  They get the extra star for the great care they take with their store and the outstanding customer service.  

I think the standouts for me are their turkey/ham and cheese on a jalapeno croissant.  Always hits the spot on a foggy Outer Sunset morning.  Another thing to note is their coffee assortment.  There are always at least a handful of different types of hot coffee for you to choose from.  Also, when you order iced coffee, they actually use coffee ice cubes so when they melt, they don't dilute your drink. 

The customer service at Twisted is unparalleled.  The employees always have a smile on their faces and ensure that your visit is going well/you have everything that you need.  Every time I come in I am always pleased with my experience.  Today, they went above and beyond:  I had a mini cellphone emergency when I got to my car and couldn't locate the little bugger.  It was super early, and I was barely a couple sips into my first coffee of the day.  I ran back and the two people at the counter helped me look for it.  They called my phone and told me they'd contact me if it showed up.  Alas, my car had eaten it up and it was wedged between the seat and the console.  Disaster averted.    

Moral of the story: come for the donuts/baked goods and coffee, stay for the amazing customer service.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I have been here a few times to study with friends and family. The staff is are pretty friendly and it is a good, comfortable environment to study or do homework. However, the donuts here are just ok and not as moist as I typically would prefer. The tables and chairs near the windows are pretty sticky from leftover glaze and sugar, so I like to sit at the smaller tables near the register to do homework. 

The iced coffee is pretty good and I like the coffee ice cubes! They have cool weekend specialty donuts with interesting flavors and I like the cream puffs, which are 75 cents.

Overall, I have mixed feelings about Twisted, so I'm between 3 and 4 stars.
author: Jessica L.

description: This spot is DA BOMB!!! Their donuts are on point - fresh, delicious, great variety of flavors (I had the special Lemon Berry today, sooooo good). Their iced coffee is also amazing, I'm a sucker for the hazelnut - and it comes with coffee ice cubes! The best part though is the friendly service. The owner is super nice and always has a smile on her face - you can really tell that her work is a labor of love  The cherry on top was when Africa by Toto started playing on the radio. Best donuts in the Sunset for sure!! #blessed
author: Molly G.

description:
I have officially named this place as the best donuts in the Sunset/Parkside area. Fried every night by the owner and operator, Paul Lim these babies are extremely delicious and amazing. The specialty is the bacon jalapeño maple doughnut or the blueberry cake donut. And of course there's coffee drinks and an espresso machine to accompany the delicious treats. On the weekend you can go for incredible cream puffs or other weekend specials !
check their website for the ever-changing specials. Local San Franciscans have always supported Small business that put out quality products. 
JYW highly recommends twisted donuts
author: Jeff W.

description: This is definitely my new go to donut place in the Sunset! I went on a weekday with a friend and it wasn't too crowded. After we went in and grabbed a table, we checked out the assortment. We both ended up getting maple bacon donuts and it was probably the best one I've had in a while. The chai latte wasn't bad but it was pretty pricey. Overall, my experience good and I even got some donuts to go! The cherry on top was the great customer service.
author: Abby L.

description:
The donuts are very familiar, very very familiar, similar even, and that's not a bad thing.

Did you like the donuts with fruity cereal on top? Did you like donuts with maple glaze and bacon slices on top? Did you have those donuts elsewhere? If yes, then you'd like them here as well.

Bonus: this shop is in San Francisco instead of, you know, San Jose.

Four Stars.

"Seriously, I highly recommend this shop." -Me
author: James G.

description:
Donuts are some of my favorite things about life. Ever. So ya know I gotta check out the local donut shop. I've been to Twisted a couple of times now and tried quite a few of their donuts. Some are FREAKIN FANTASTIC. And others just aren't my cup of tea. So it's definitely a hit and miss sometimes. But overall, very delicious donuts. They have a lot of different combinations of donuts. Some crazy combinations. I'm not into fruity flavors so I generally trend towards the nutella or peanut butter ones. I also love their cream puffs. 

The one thing I really didn't like was called the furrito or something? The deep fried nutella burrito thing. I can't remember what exactly it is called. But I did not like that one AT ALL. It was way too crunchy. But that's really the only one I've tried that I really hated. All the other donuts I've tried were SOLID. Not literally. Figuratively. 

Their donuts are very sweet but it's donuts. So that's expected. I bought a dozen once. Lasted for a couple of days because I couldn't handle that much sugar in one sitting. LOL. But the cream puffs are probably my favorite because they're always perfect no matter what.
author: Amy T.

description: We love this place the customer service is great. Always greeted with a smile. And the donuts are really good and creative.
author: Carolyne R.

description: A very simple and quiet place right across from Home! I got the Maple Pecan Buttermilk Bar & the Twisted Glaze. Both were delicious & fresh! The customer service was amazing & everyone there was really friendly. I'd definitely come back again.
author: Stacie I.

description:
My friends and I came here on a whim for breakfast after finding out that our first donut shop choice was closed. But this place was so good that I was sososo grateful we came here instead. I ordered the maple bacon, blueberry, chocolate with cream filled donut, and buttermilk bar.

Maple Bacon donut - tasted like a beautiful Sunday morning 5/5

Blueberry donut - the most amazing blueberry donut I've ever tasted. Seriously. It was so yummy and the blueberries were so fresh! My friend went and bought some to take home because they were so good. 

Buttermilk bar - yummy but not my fave 4/5 

Chocolate with Cream - also really tasty and not too sweet 5/5

Oh yeah and it was on a Monday so there was a buy 3 get 1 free deal (which is perfect because you'll want to try all the flavors)! 

And s/o to Jenny for being one of the nicest cashiers I've ever met! Her customer service was exceptional! If I lived in SF I'd stop here for breakfast every day.
author: Kelly N.

description: Nice freshly baked donuts walking distance from my house. Had a bacon maple glazed donut and it was delicious!  Hubby had an apple fritter and enjoyed it thoroughly. I heard on the weekends they have bacon jalapeño donuts. Gotta come back to try.
author: Donna L.

description:
Donuts were fresh and delicious. We had a strawberry sprinkle and a plain cake donut. Coffee is a notch above. Prices very reasonable, especially for San Francisco. 

Family-owned place. Super friendly and efficient service from Jenny. I appreciated how nice she was to my dad, especially when he seemed overwhelmed by the choices. Will definitely return.
author: Jeanie S.

description: The donuts here are not bad, but they are not my favorite. They put a "twist" on their weekend donuts, but I prefer the "twisted" donuts at Psycho Donuts in San Jose. I had the blueberry jelly donut, which was pretty good considering I've never seen other donut shops serve blueberry jelly. The blueberry cake donut holes were okay. We also tried the bacon maple donut, and to be honest I've had better at other donut shops. My boyfriend ordered a cup of coffee, and he ended up throwing half of it out because it wasn't good!
author: Keisha K.

description:
I actually don't like donuts so I'm writing about the coffee from this place.  I came in yesterday for a quick iced coffee on my way to work and I've come here before, but this time, she asked me hazelnut or regular?  And I thought, what the heck, let's try hazelnut and BOY WAS I GLAD I DID. 

Now, I know coffee, as with all foods, tastes different to all people because of preferences, but the hazelnut iced coffee was definitely 10/10 for me.  It was earthy and bold and had a strong hazelnut taste to it WITHOUT the fruity somewhat acidity that some coffees have.  I know some people like the sour acidity, but I personally don't.  I like the more robust, earthy flavors and that's it.  It was also pretty strong and I'll definitely be back for that iced coffee to study!
author: Jonathan W.

description: Lots of choices and great price as well! Wish there were more than just two of us so we could try more flavors. Donuts are delicious! Def would come back here to try out the different flavors. Liked that coming early there are no lines are lots of choices!
author: Tina D.

description:
After a lovely coffee date across the street with my fiancé, we decided to kill some time by walking around because our meter was not up. 

We stopped by here and the donuts looked sooo good but we were stuffed. We were actually going to leave without a donut until the jalapeno and bacon donut caught our eye. We've never seen a spicy donut before and was intrigued. 

The owner was super friendly and let us know that our eyes are not deceiving us and that it was indeed jalapenos on a donut! She informed us that many people mistaken them for green onions. I can totally see green onions working on a donut too though!!

The donut was decent in size, not too big and not too small. It was super fluffy and it stayed fresh until 10pm. The donut itself was glazed with maple & topped with jalapeno shards and bacon squares. I only wish that they incoporated jalapenos inside the dough or added slices of jalapeno instead. I love heat and I needed more but I can totally see why they toned it down as majority of the people would probably complain about it being too spicy.

Keep up with the awesome ideas, make more spicy donuts and savory ones. I'll be here to try them all. Perhaps with some Carolina reaper or habaneros? Totally can see this donut place putting themselves on the map with more innovations and maybe a spicy donut challenge! 

Coffee is cheaper than Home here and there's seats, so if you're not digging the crazy line across the street, def make a stop here!
author: Kelly L.

description:
The Warriors donut was freakin awesome. I bought them right when they opened and it was probably the best cake donut I've ever had. 
They should only bring them out on game days.
author: Stormtrooper N.

description:
Donuts are one of my weaknesses. I always look for the best donut shops when I travel and I love them so much that they become my carry-on items when I fly home! Luckily, SF has some pretty decent donut shops and Twisted Donuts is definitely one of them.

Twisted is a neighborhood spot with a homey feel. The service is friendly and personable and the prices are amazing! It's rare to find fresh quality donuts at chain store prices, but the $1 donut still lives on here! They also have fun picks like the maple bacon jalapeno donut! 

Favorites: 
1) Blueberry donuts (and blueberry donut holes) 
2) Donut holes stuffed w/ cream
3) Old-fashioned chocolate 
4) Apple fritter 

And to top it all off? Their iced coffee is made with COFFEE ICE CUBES. Suck on that hipster coffee shops!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
First came here with my husband because everywhere else we wanted to go was closed, and I was very happy with the service! The donuts and coffee were great, but I thought that the service was outstanding! There was only one person working (on New Years Eve, so that's understandable), and he greeted us with a smile and very patiently helped us with our order. It has a very cozy and local feel. 

It's a very relaxing and chill environment-a good place to study or kickback and relax with some friends. I definitely recommend coming here, not only for the food, but the great service as well.
author: Karin C.

description: I came here with my friend to study and the service was super great! We bought some donuts but they were a bit too doughy for my taste. There were also a good amount of people coming in and out of the shop, but my friend and I could still stay focused. I really liked the ambiance of Twisted and would definitely come again!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I have been dying to try TDC's maple baconpeño donut and I finally made a trip specifically for these donuts last Sunday. I probably got a little too excited, but I ordered a full dozen of donuts to share and to have for breakfast the next day. 

Here's what I ordered:

-5x Maple Baconpeño: DELICIOUS. The best donuts of the entire bunch! The donut is soft and not too bready and I appreciate the bacon and jalapeño pieces throughout since you get pieces in every bite. I just wish there could be more jalapeño pieces. No regrets ordering 5 of these bad boys. 

-Cookies & Cream Bar: This was essentially a dessert donut. The chocolate donut bar was the bun with whipped cream and Oreos in middle. Good, but probably wouldn't get again because it was too sweet for me. 

-Granola Donut: Donut with vanilla icing, granola bits, and chocolate chips. Good, but not my favorite.

-Bear Claw: MASSIVE but kind of cute because of the shape. It's filled with apple pie filling so it's like a glazed donut pie. Would get again.

-Cinnamon Bun: Not really a cinnamon bun, but a huge sticky bun with some cinnamon. Good and simple. 

-Gummy Bear Donut: SO CUTE! Vanilla icing with a ring of gummy bears. Texturally strange, but the taste is not bad. 

-Jelly Donut: I did not try this but I am told it was good. 

-50 cent cream puffs: Bite sized whipped cream bites. Not bad. I would get these again if I were in the mood. 


Overall, great donut shop. I would definitely go back for the maple baconpeño alone!
author: Sofia R.

description:
TBH, Twisted is just like any other donut shop.

They have all of your standard donuts, but I was looking for the more unique ones...crazy concoctions...but the closest ones that were "out there" were the maple bacon donuts and blueberry. I got the blueberry, and it was a delicious moist 3 bites, but nothing unlike any of the other blueberry donuts I've had in the past. I soon realized after scrolling through the yelp pics, that the special ones were made during special events...like for the Warriors final games or for certain situations. Fair enough.

The space itself isn't anything aesthetically pleasing, but for a donut shop...it's cozy, got lots of seating, and monochromatic. It kind of feels like a high school cafeteria in terms of the color palette, but it's spacious and old-school.

The only thing I'd shoutout more would be the sweet service. The lady running the place was SO friendly and welcoming, and even urged us to take napkins with us as we walked out with our to-go donuts!
author: Jodi H.

description:
The pumpkin fritter is life changing! Better get yours if you're a pumpkin fan, it's seasonal. 

I was a little disappointed that whip cream wasn't available for my husband's coffee but other than that, great breakfast & Donuts. I will be back
author: Susan V.

description: Almost 3 years that my bf and I have been coming here. They never disappoint and always hits the spot. I love the fun variety on the weekends but the classics are always amazing. The donuts are always great but what keeps us loyal is the amazing customer service. The main lady who I assume is the owner is always greeting everyone with a big smile and is so warm. 12/10 I would recommend
author: Dalia P.

description: So I give it a one star, not for its donuts because I didn't get to try any. We drove from Pacifica to try these donuts because the pictures looked awesome but when we got there it was closed, stating that they ran out of donuts. I'm disappointed since the drive took 45 mins of our day, they should've updated it on Yelp so we didn't have to waste our time.
author: Ai T.

description: This place will be there for you in hard times. A judgement-free zone for when stumbling in on Sunday morning after too much partying.
author: Marcel A.

description:
Woo hoo! This place was open on Thanksgiving and New Year's Day!

The plain doughnut and the blueberry cake doughnut were delicious. Both had a light fluffiness to them, almost spongelike. The chocolate with sprinkles and the blueberry were on the sweeter side but they were so good. I liked the cream puff too. 

There's an assortment of things to try. I'll certainly be back. Street parking only.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Really glad my boyfriend showed me this place. It's so close to where I live and I never knew it was there! 

When I went I got a coconut donut and a maple bar and both were super fresh and yummy, especially the coconut one!! 

Definitely going to go back next time I want donuts :)
author: Hayley D.

description: The woman who I always see here is so incredibly sweet!! The donuts are always really good and fresh and I love all the special types they have on the weekends. My favorite donut spot by far!!
author: Ellie R.

description:
Twisted donuts?!?!?
Not only I live by this place, but I also saw it in the top 10 donut shops in sf, smh what is this list based on?  I'm not a donut aficionado by any means, however from time to time I do enjoy a ham and cheese croissant.

Once you get to twisted donuts, you see their awesome sign that looks like it's a shop out of the Simpson's.  They definitely have a big variety of donuts and croissants, I have tried the croissants with turkey and cheese, ham and chees, ham cheese and jalapenos, as far as donuts I had one of the one with Bavarian cream and the peanut butter and jelly donut.  I must say the Bavarian cream itself it's great, however I'm not too impressed with the donut a little to dense for me, same complaint with the penut butter and jelly donut.  As for the croissants they are great, my only complaint is they warm it up in a microwave and not an oven :(, I don't mind paying over $4 for a croissant but I'd like the consistency to stay the same.   
O and by the way the selection of coffee is great.

I'm definitely coming back since I walk my dog this way every morning, however the price to quality is a bit off, hopefully they'll work out the kinks.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: While I have not been here, I did try to do a custom donut order. Paul was amazing. He wanted to make sure he got every detail of the order right. He emailed me all of his ideas for how to decorate the donut so I could approve it all before they were made. If I need custom donuts in San Francisco again, I will definitely go to Twisted Donuts.
author: Alexa L.

description:
Hipster and traditional donuts coexist in this small, yet popular Twisted Donuts & Coffee shop in the Outer Sunset district.

Maple bacon seems to be a popular flavor, so I had to try it for myself. Typically maple-flavored anything tends to be too sweet for me, but the bacon really helped tone the sweetness down by balancing it with yummy savory goodness. I mean, who doesn't love bacon? 

Another popular flavor here is the blueberry donut. I enjoyed how this one had a more dense but still fluffy cake-like texture. There's real blueberries mixed into the batter and the minimal outer sugar syrup coating added just a little sweetness.

The owner, Jenny, is really sweet. Monday promotion is buy 3 get 1 free deal, and they usually have specialty flavors on the weekends. I don't consider myself a donut person, but Twisted is worth revisiting if I have cravings.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I've been checking out Twisted from afar on Instagram for the last year. I'm a donut fan, but only in moderation. Finally, this past Sunday, my SO and I headed out to Outer Sunset to check out the temptatious donuts that I've been drooling over.

The minute we walked in, the cashier was so friendly and helpful. He gave honest recommendations.  From blueberry, creme puffs, nutella furritos, and oreo filled donuts, there was quite a selection to choose from. Note that they only have the special menu on the weekends, and standard donuts during the week.

We ordered the PB & J donut (my SO loved this) and the maple bacon donut sans jalapeños, as I'm indeed a sucker for bacon. I've had the dynamo donut version, and was torn at which one I thought was better. They do have larger pieces of bacon and the donut was bigger overall with more air in the donut and not as dense. 

I almost went for the nutella furrito, but this isn't a donut. It has a crispy wrap. Though I may try that one in the future because how can you say "no" each time to nutella?

We ate these two donuts in the shop along with a cup of coffee. Donuts were fresh. Standard coffee with a number of flavors to choose from but no speciality espresso drinks. 

We also ordered a few blueberry donut holes and a creme puff. Note we could not eat this all in one sitting and still have a few more to go (it's the next day). 

Great place to try creative, tasty donuts on the weekends. If you follow them on social media, they generally announce the type of donuts they will offer in advance.
author: Nova P.

description:
I went Sunday at 10am to buy a dozen as a gift for a block party host. The selection was terrific and it was hard to keep it at 12 (I got 13). They have many items not in the front case, so be sure to ask for something if you want something specific. I'd definitely go back. 

I got: plain cruller, maple cruller, 2 sprinkled orange glaze, plain glazed, choco glazed, strawberry glazed, cinnamon apple fritter, custard filled + blueberry filled + lemon filled (the outside of these filled donuts were not guessable), and I can't remember the last 2.
author: Loocha L.

description: Jenny is such a doll!!! I didn't get the other guys name but he was super friendly as well. Roommate and I went in and she got a maple donut and I got a jalapeño maple. Both were pretty bomb, definitely will be back. they also have a stamp card ! The great thing tho it's not an actually card but an electronic stamp card. Just put in your number
author: Kathie A.

description:
Super friendly staff and AMAZING donuts at reasonable prices. Blueberry is the best for sure! With their jelly donuts and fritters following in a close second and third. They also have savory croissants like jalapeño ham and cheese. Yum. They almost always add in a little something extra too. :) Great neighborhood donut shop! I recommend grabbing some donuts and crossing the street to Home for some good coffee!

$10 credit card minimum!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Not too over the top like the one in another state LOL 
Had the weekend special  S'mores. Chocolate raised with mini marshmallows and Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal. The lady will 'torch' it to make it resemble "s'mores ". 

My son tried the bacon one and liked it. Lots of bacon topped on chocolate raised. 

Lots of choices.  Try one if you're in the area.
author: Margaret W.

description:
It's painful for me to give Twisted Donuts and Coffee a mere 3-star review because everything I set eyes on in the shop looked so promising and the staff is always so friendly. Unfortunately, I found that everything I've tried was a little too sweet and dense for my taste.

Here's what I've tried:

- 'Smores donut: I should've known that it was going to be too sweet, but I simply can't pass up anything that with chocolate and marshmallow on top of it!
- Donut holes (blueberry, powdered, sprinkles): I was so disappointed by how dense and dry they were. I love my donut holes and it's so rare to find anything to complain about! 
- Donut with pink (strawberry?) glaze and sprinkles: This was probably my favorite thing from Twisted Donuts

It's a shame, because Twisted Donuts could've, would've and should've been my new go to donut spot.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Super nice staff, clean place, different flavors of hot coffee, iced coffee with real coffee cubes, and plentiful donuts for any donut lover. The mini blueberry donut holes are my favorite. They are bite-sized with a sheer glaze and sweet. I love that this donut shop is open very early in the morning, and the lady who works there is always nice.
author: Joanne K.

description: Someone brought home donuts from Twisted.  I had a chocolate bar.  The chocolate is sort of runny - in a Safeway way.  However the donut is fresh and it doesn't have that oily flavor that Safeway has.
author: Wendy H.

description: I love donuts. I love this place because not only are the donuts good but the people that work there super cool. You got to try the maple with bacon bits on top as well as a blueberry and or orange cake donut but after a while they all start to taste the same after you eat too many.
author: Nerdy G.

description: Eh. That's about all I can say, is this place was just average. Absolutely nothing special about the actual dough. The dough was just what you would find at any corner donut shop. Nothing special. I tried 5 different donuts and all the same. Wish I had tried dynamo as I was intending to.
author: Frank G.

description:
This is a great doughnut shop. Super fast and super awesome. 

It's like most little hole in the wall shops. Pumping out great doughnuts all day long. The smell drove me in l, also I am a sucker for sweets. 

I got the orange glazed sprinkle and a old fashioned maple glazed, soo good.

Perfect for a dessert or breakfast, he'll
Even for a mid day snack. 

I shouldn't have to twist your arm to try Twisted doughnuts
author: Andrew H.

description: Fresh donuts no matter what time you go. Not a huge selection but they do have specialty ones such as bacon. The dough is soft and fluffy - doesn't feel heavy. $1.50 for cream filled but under $1 for regular chocolate ones.
author: Julie L.

description: To be honest I'll give most doughnut places 5 stars because doughnut are amazing and I feel like they are difficult to mess up (at least in my doughnut loving mind) Twisted is bomb af! I went here with a friend and we tried a bunch of different things and I loved all of them. My favorite was the Pb&j doughnut with the chocolate cookies and cream as a close second. The apple fritters were amazing as well! I love that they change up their specialty doughnuts each week, I'll certainly be back for more!
author: Paige M.

description: Fresh donut made it everyday for Easter they have little better ones so cute. They have chocolate bacon Donuts s'more Donuts blueberry donut they have everything here and it's super good super nice super clean.
author: Michele T.

description:
Made with love, heart and soul. 

After several visits had the pleasure of meeting the owner. Paul was awesome. Loved hearing about his family donut business, his donut tutelage, and the art of donuts. 

I'm a sucker for fresh donuts. The simple sugar is my favorite. Classics and new school, imaginative combinations done right. 

Great addition to the neighborhood. Easy parking.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Woke up on a rainy Monday morning and realized that it was past 6. Knowing that they ran out of donuts fast after reading their Yelp reviews, I groggily called the shop and asked to put a blueberry cake donut on hold! 

-The shop is clean and homey. They have a Monday special where when you buy 3 donuts you get 1 more for free. The woman at the counter was very friendly, and even conversed with me.

-They have free wifi so it's one of those shops where you can buy a cup of coffee/donut and sit down for a long time and mooch off their wifi.
author: Erica K.

description:
Umm hello? Jalapeno maple bacon donut? OMG. Personally..i'm not a big donut fan..BUT if you're into that whole fancy, smancy donut craze, then you would really appreciate the donuts here. My friends loved the jalapeno donut. 

Why the four stars if i don't even like donuts? Well my friends, this little joint makes one of the best cups of ice coffee in the sunset that i've had. The icing on the cake? Instead of regular ice cubes, they use coffee ice cubes to keep your drink cold and refreshing without diluting that baby. 

Oh and a medium/pretty giant size cup is only $2. Where else would you find that in the city?
author: Diane T.

description:
1). Donuts were unique and delicious.
2). Coffee was meh.
3). Atmosphere was meh.
4). Definitely get the donuts to go.
5). Would go back but wish they had even more variety of interesting and new donuts.
author: Robert W.

description: THIS WAS SUCH A COOL PLACE! We walked in expecting just a regular old donut shop, but wow were we surprised! I got the s'mores donut and to my surprised they BLOWTORCHED it so the marshmallows were all melted and then topped it with chocolate syrup they also had bacon/jalepeno donuts and Nutella fritters and little bunny donuts for Easter! The lady who helped us was also super friendly, I would go out of my way to go here again!
author: Jasmine O.

description:
I've been to this spot a number of times now (exactly 25 times now based on my stamp card, but who's counting right?). Needless to say, I'm a fan of what they do. Legit, tasty donuts with a wide variety of options to chose from and some of the absolute best cream puffs I've ever had. 

Now, I'm a sucker for donuts, so there was a high chance I was going to love this spot from the gecko. BUT, I know my donuts and I can definitely vouch for these bad boys. What really makes this place special is that they have incredibly friendly staff. The lady (presumably the owner) is sweet and kind and always helps out when you don't know what you want. They also have a huge selection of coffee (check out my picture), and as a die hard coffee addict it's refreshing to see the amount of pours they have. 

When it's all said and done, a deserving place to be named one of the best spots for donuts in SF. Come check them out.
author: Alex B.

description:
So glad Twisted Donuts recently opened up near my house!

The must get items are definitely the maple bacon donut ($2.75) and the blueberry donut ($1)/donut holes (12/$2)! I finally got to try the maple bacon donut today (snatched the last two!) and it was delicious! I heated it up for 20 seconds at home and it was perfect. The bacon on top really went well with the maple flavor, and added a nice crunch! I just wish they had more bacon on top, haha. The blueberry donuts are really tasty too, they're soft and have a cake-like texture. 

The employees are really sweet here! My bf and I came in for the first time when they ran out of maple bacon (it was only 1pm! So keep that in mind) and she let us know that we could call ahead next time to see if they had them. Today when I came in, I was sure to call before. She even ended up throwing a few donut holes in my bag! :)

Oh yeah, on Mondays they have buy 3 get 1 free! The donuts are pretty cheap already, but this is a great deal if you're picking up for family or friends.

I will definitely be back! I've seen some pictures on yelp of captain crunch and oreo donuts, so I can't wait to try other specialty ones.
author: Tara A.

description:
Hands down my favorite donut shop in SF. They mostly do traditional flavors (or maybe it's that their specialty ones are all sold out by the time I visit?) but that's exactly what I love--give me a simple sugar donut over one that has cereal, bacon, chocolate, and jam all over it any day.

I'm not sure if the ingredients are ~artisan~ or ~organic~ or whatever, but what I can say is that the dough here is incredible. Every bite tastes FRESH. Every bite is satisfyingly chewy and thoughtfully sweet. I prefer denser donuts so my go-tos are the blueberry donut holes (a dozen lasts me 2 days, they're so good), the buttermilk bar, and the plain glazed old-fashioned. But I have a feeling practically every offering they have here won't disappoint.

Some protips: $7 minimum to use credit card but the staff will sweetly throw a few donut holes for you if you buy a box.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Twisted Donuts (Jenny) did a fantastic job with baby shower pink glazed doughnuts. 50 doughnuts were ready to go at 7am. Our 90+ guests commented on how incredible the doughnuts tasted and asked "...where where where did you get these!..".
Yes we will go back.
Yes we will order again.
Yes I highly recommend Twisted Donuts!
Yes we ran out of doughnuts during the baby shower!
author: Pstephan A.

description: Opens early and the smell of delicious donuts fill the air! Mocha is way better than other shops.
author: Matt V.

description: The lady(I suck at remembering names) at the counter is one of the most friendliest people I have come across in a donut shop. We were greeted with a smile and although there weren't many options for filled donuts left when we got their at 9:30 she offered to fill some of the bar donuts that were left. I ended up getting a blueberry and lemon filled donuts. Both were very good. The filling wasn't too sweet and the dough itself was nice. Coffee was great as well. I need to come back right when they open so I can try some of their weekend specials.
author: S P.

description: I only get the Cream Puffs! Looking forward to getting other types of doughnuts eventuallys . . . Looks like a nice place to hang out after a long day at work.
author: Julio B.

description:
I came too late on a Saturday afternoon (I think around 3pm), and they were already sold out of their famous Blueberry donuts by that time (along with a lot of other donuts). The moral of the story is- come early if you want something specific!!

From Top L to R: Chocolate Raised (w/White Chocolate Chips, Granola), Bacon Maple Glazed Donut, Apple Fritter, Cream Puff [http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=jE5AhYesu4k2IZvNew2syA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg]: The favorite was surprisingly the chocolate raised. I thought the combination of toppings would be too sweet, but it worked really well with the chewy and fluffy donut. I'll definitely have to come back to try their regular glazed raised donuts. The bacon maple was good, but doesn't live up to the hype- I feel like I've had better versions elsewhere. There need more maple flavor, or something. The apple fritter was good, but again, not amazing, and same with the cream puff. The only donut I would get again is the chocolate raised, but I will definitely be back to try the blueberry donut and try other flavors! The staff here is friendly, and the most difficult part about coming here will be the parking, since there isn't a lot of street parking available.
author: Amy D.

description: Had the best breakfast ever!! #7 and a maple cream donut. Hubby got #12, love it. It's worth the trip.
author: shawnie m.

description:
I was soooo excited to try out some donuts during an early Sunday afternoon. My friend and I stayed here for a bit and tried out their Maple Bacon Donut, Glazed Blueberry Donut, a donut hole and cream puff. The donuts had the right amount of soft bite as expected from a donut along with great texture. It's sooo good! They event have cute donut pillows hanging by the window. 
I'm glad I chose to get the Blueberry Donut as recommended by the server. It's one of my new fave donut flavors as of now. 
(Note: Make sure to bring cash. If using card, minimum is ~ $10.)
author: Vivian L.

description:
Decent donuts! Probably has the most unique donuts in the sunset neighborhood. I've been to Psycho donuts In San Jose, SK donuts and DK donuts in SoCal, & Blue Star Donuts in Portland, and Twisted is the closest donut shop like those in NorCal.  

FOOD: For the regular donuts, this store gets a 3 start, but or attempted creativity and being the only one in the neighborhood, I bumped it up to a 4 star. They have various rotating specialty donuts flavors such as cookies and cream, smores, maple bacon, and cereal topped ones. Beware though, most specialty flavors run out fast!

SERVICE: the owner is super friendly. If you buy a box, she'll throw in some free doughnut holes :) 

AMBIANCE: free WiFi, great lighting, bathroom included, and a couple of tables.
author: Samantha F.

description:
A new study shows that eating donuts regularly will help you achieve a sexy body and maximize your lyrical potential. In the study, the lyrics of a rapper was analyzed everyday by a researcher. The overwhelming evidence convinced the researcher to deem that no further research is necessary. Here are his findings. 

"I'm on a diet but I'm doing Donuts in a six speed."  
-Nicki Minaj, Up All Night 
Bibliography/Source: RapGenius

Through deep analysis of the findings, the researcher discovered that donuts will help you get a body so sexy that it will cause Drake to drool.

"It is abundantly clear that eating donuts from Twisted will help achieve this result. The complex structure of the Maple Bacon Donut along with Coffee and Almond Milk, creates a protein that helps your butt grow exponentially. Evidence shows that it certainly helped Ms. Minaj."

In addition to neglecting side effects of a high donut diet such as cholesterol and diabetes, the researcher is convinced that the donuts from Twisted can actually bolster one's rapping ability.

"I don't think I'm overstepping the boundaries of science by saying that the sugar from the Sugar Donut will make your voice sweeter. It's simple logic. What we are also suspecting is that the Apple Cinnamon Bear Claw will make your voice feisty. After all, one of Ms. Minaj's signature ability is to sound feisty during the punchline."

While this research has gain momentum with the researcher himself and his mom, the findings of the research has yet to penetrate the mainstream. The researcher does not seem fazed.

"I am working hard everyday to promote my findings in the science community. I'm usually using the free wifi at Twisted to send out my thesis."

It remains unclear if the researcher is actually serious about his findings. Other patrons of Twisted suspects that he is just lying to himself about the health benefits of the donuts. Many say it's because he is addicted to them.
author: Ringo M.

description: A representative reached out to me and explained that it was a training issue, and thanked me for my review. Explained that my concerns were addressed with the staff, and that my concerns and experience were ironed out for future experiences. As I stated in my initial review. The staff and the owners are truly nice people. They offered me a discount on my next visit for my troubles. That will not be necessary. I will continue to support this business. This shows me that Twisted Donuts and its ownership truly cares about its business and customers. Thank you!!!!
author: Tony C.

description:
Finally had a chance to stop in again (a couple of times actually) and try out their donuts again. Maybe the first time I visited it was an off day?

I've had the blueberry donut holes (12 for $3.50) = good

Chocolate old fashion = good, but smaller than other donut shops.

Creme filled donut holes (?) = good and the cream was not too sweet.

Mondays buy 3 get one free! Donut holes don't qualify...
author: Liz N.

description: Found this place as I was I was waiting for my doctors appointment early in the morning. It was quiet with only one other person there but the lady that was working was very attentive and kind. I tried the glazed blueberry donut with was pleasant and not too sweet. It was a perfect snack to curve my hunger. Service and quality was great, the only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is because they didn't have as many options/varieties of donuts as I'd like. Still great place for delicious donuts!
author: Erika V.

description: Donuts are okay.  Nothing to brag about and I was hoping to see more of a selection.  They only had a few flavors as far as the colored icing goes.  Service is okay.  Nothing to gloat about.  I wanted to try their warriors donuts but they didn't have them.  It's a blue doughnut with yellow drizzled glaze on top...other than that, just OK.
author: Jill P.

description:
Been wanting to try Twisted Donuts for awhile!  What a great addition to Outer Sunset!  He and are usually donut simplelists as we loved glazed donut holes.  But I'll admit it, I love a good bacon maple donut!  I haven't done Dynamo or any other fancy places, except for Do-Rite in Chicago.  I can tell you though, I didn't like Dunkin Donuts and I hate Krispy Kreme.  

We stopped in on Thanksgiving morning maybe around 9:30 or 10, and there was only one lady working her butt off helping a few hungry customers wanted to get their sugar fix before feasting on some turkey later in the day.  We got a dozen donut holes, a bacon maple donut and a raspberry jelly filled donut for $6.  Good deal.  The salty bacon and maple glaze were divine.  Donuts weren't too heavy which we liked.  The donut holes were well made and not overly sweet or overly glazed but had the right amount of glaze and were moist.  We liked his jelly filled donut too.  I like how Twisted Donuts also tries to change up their menu with some "crazy" specials like jalapeno bacon or fruity pebbles donuts.  4.5 but rounded up, because of the quality, price, hardworking and friendly service, and for being in boring Sunset.
author: Cat C.

description: I was so excited when I read Thrillist this morning and there run down of the best doughnuts in SF included a place in the Sunset that I never even knew existed. So this morning I headed there straight away. It is a small shop with a small selection of traditional doughnut shop offerings. I picked a cake doughnut with orange icing. The orange icing was very nice but the cake doughnut itself was heavy and dry. It was of the type of doughnut that leaves a coating of fat or grease in your mouth. It was just $1 and really was of that caliber. Up there on a list with the likes of Dynamo and Mr. Holmes Bakehouse.... I don't see how....
author: Steven B.

description: Wow! I stopped by here since I was in the area. The place was super clean and inviting. The service was great and my donuts were fresh and tasty! I'd come back for sure.
author: Steph L.

description:
Oh..twisted! The cool-looking exterior of this place and the Yelp reviews is what drew me in.. Unfortunately that was as good as it got. 

The service was friendly, which I always appreciate. So far..so good. Their variety of specialty donuts were so-so. I chose three because I can never try just one. 

Every single donut I tasted was extremely  dry and tasted a day or two old. The New Years special was the champagne donut, which left a horrible taste in my mouth. It was an extremely dry old fashioned donut with some flavorless frosting. 

Now I don't mind paying up to $4 a donut, but I expect good quality donuts if I do. These were extremely overpriced for the quality of donuts. I finished these donuts disappointed and wishing that I had made the trek over to Dynamo Donuts instead.
author: Kathlena H.

description:
Twisted Donuts and Coffee replaced the sushi restaurant for the past 6 weeks. Definitely a great addition to the Sunset neighborhood!

I got the glazed blueberry donut because that was the only "different" kind of donut that was left. Apparently, the other donuts was sold out. I also wanted to try the blueberry donut because reading Susy C. review made me even want it more! The donut cost $1.25. The blueberry donut was not sweet which I enjoyed.

The lady who was there was extremely sweet. She also gave me with my blueberry donut, the only donut hole left. Freebie! Score! 

I'll be back to try the other donuts like the jelly donut and the maple bacon donut!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Ugghhh. They recognize me here. I'm a loser. 

The owners are super sweet. Always smiling and eager to help me out when I am indecisive. I finally got my beloved blueberry donut!

I must say, no more trips to Anaheim for blueberry donuts. Eff that wait, I have Twisted. Light cakey fluffy donuts and never overly sweet. Blueberry donut heaven! They also have blueberry donut bites (essentially donut holes) and my 4 year old niece said that was her favorite. 

I'm a pretty big fan of the jelly filled donuts. The jelly is never too sweet. Loved the lemon! 

Iced coffee has cubes of frozen coffee in it. What a thoughtful touch!
author: Susy C.

description: Such a cute donut shop! The service was very good and the donuts are delicious. They also have espresso drinks and a good coffee selection.
author: Kelsey A C.

description:
I never thought I would give such praise to a donut shop, but here it is! 

While & I were doing some banking at Chase next door, we noticed a new store that opened up a few stores down. We walked in and was immediately greeted by the staff, which turned out to be the owners. It must have been our body language but the guy behind the counter seem to notice it's our first time, and began to recommend their best sellers. 

* Maple bacon: Awesome. Perfect amount of salty, tasty bacon laid out on top of a donut that actually had maple flavor (unlike Uncle Benny's on Irving, which just tasted like sugar) 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/uncle-bennys-san-francisco?hrid=xXUUS2e3ewOsfs4NUt0wIg
* Orange donut: Fresh, soft and a noticeable orange flavor. Very good but like most donuts, very sweet.
* Blueberry: Also very sweet, but also fresh. I'm a fan! 
* Glazed old fashioned: My usual everywhere I go. Fresh, soft and very good. 

My buddy got a couple of their chocolate donuts & before I can ask for a bite, he inhaled them. (Greedy ass!) So I assume they were good. 

Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to try their blueberry bites, the PB&J or the maple bacon & jalapeno yet.... but I will! 

I love supporting family owned shops as opposed to large chains (ie.Dunkin', Krispy Kreme ...etc) and Twisted is no exception. The owners are friendly, helpful, and genuinely glad to see customers walk in. They got the customer service skills down! Next time I'm visiting SF, I'll make sure to go in again. 

notes: 
*metered street parking on Noreiga can be annoying. 
* blueberry bites are served only on weekends
* they have specials not served daily, check them out on facebook
* if their maple bacon sells out, ask them when the next batch is coming out of the oven. it might be a short wait & totally worth it. 
* yes, coffee will go great w/ these fried sweet treats. 
* accepts credit card for purchases over $7.00
* at random times, there's a line out the door onto the street. have patience.
author: James L.

description:
I haven't actually had a donut, but my husband and daughter like the chocolate, glaze, and sugar. We pick up donut holes for the kids' baseball and soccer teams. They are a great go-to! 

I cannot resist the 50 cent cream puffs. The coffee is good, and so is the iced coffee! The iced coffee has ice cubes made of coffee, so it is not watery when it melts! 

I've seen goods come fresh out of the oven. I love that everything is made fresh. 

Every staff member we have encountered have been friendly and warm. We will always come back!
author: Lani S.

description:
Read an article about the best donuts in SF and this one was voted one of them so of course I had to try it. 

I tried the cookies and cream, a cream puff, maple and vanilla twist, blueberry donuts, and a glazed buttermilk. $11 for 6 donuts?!?! I've never paid that much for donuts. The pricing is pretty high for a donut shop and the donuts were too sweet. I couldn't finish any of them. Each and every single donut tasted like the dough was pure sugar. I had high hopes for this spot because of all the reviews. I'm not a fan of bacon so I didn't try their bacon donut. But I don't think I'll come back. 

They had really good customer service, so I added an extra star.
author: Dara S.

description:
Cheery, inviting and clean little donut shop.  Friendly and enthusiastic donut lady clerk.  My husband and I ordered a dozen regular donuts + two special donuts.  Donut lady threw in several donut holes.  Good public relations!   
Donuts are fresh, fluffy and delicious.  Will definitely be back.  Thank you!
author: Corine C.

description:
Came to buy the maple bacon donuts, but they were sold out as they're popular.  We ended up buying:

Glazed twist - nice & fluffy.  I don't think one can really mess up this donut.
Chocolate Custard - mister said it was extremely sweet! 
Apple Fritter - just ok
Blueberry Donut - extremely sweet and would not repurchase!
Glazed Old Fashion - I asked for old fashion without the glaze as I was buying this for my mom.  I even re confirmed with the lady And she said it was original.  But when I opened the box when I got home, I had a glazed old fashion!!!

Service was friendly and she threw in a complimentary orange donut.  I just wished she listened better.
author: Candice H.

description: My favorite donut shop.  Everyone who works there is so sweet!
author: N G.

description:
I've never been crazy much about donuts, but the ones at Twisted is addictive.  I normally get the ones glazed with nuts on top, so sweet, so delicious.  But the best is the free one that they provide.  It's just a regular glazed, but it's so soft and fluffy, it makes me feel like it's the best donut ever.

I really appreciate that they still give out a free donut, and that it wasn't just a gimmick to get customers when they first opened.  Great service, great prices.  I definitely want to keep coming back.
author: Karen L.

description:
very friendly service

spacious seating.  not many tables, but most of the time it's not full

good coffee... i even got a non-sweetened Hazelnut iced coffee... nice surprise

nice selection of donuts, including some creative/inspired ones like Warriors donut

good clean restroom

free stable wifi

can't ask for much more
author: gswfan ..

description: Got a blueberry donut hole (cake donut) which had a nice blueberry flavor. Also got a special of the day blueberry buttermilk bar for hubby. He semi-enjoyed it. He said it was average but had a nice crust.
author: Jean K.

description: YES YES YES! One of the best things about my boyfriend's new apartment is its proximity to Twisted Donuts. I am a sucker for their sugar donut - the flavor and consistency is perfect. I've tried the chocolate bar and donut holes which are delicious but I'd highly recommend trying the burrito style desserts - excellent crunch and flavor. Reasonable prices and friendly service too.
author: Anne G.

description: Maple bacon donut and a coffee brightens up any Monday morning! You've definitely got to try it if you haven't! Every time I grab one I just do an extra 10 minutes of cardio!
author: David P.

description:
Moist and delicious. Not super light, but not too dense. Frosting was good, I got the One with orange frosting (without sprinkles). The maple bacon looked enticing enough, but I'd never had an orange frosted donut before. 

The place is clean and everything seems fresh. Sweet, enthusiastic lady behind the counter really wanted us to take advantage of the Monday deal: buy three get one free, but we insisted that we only wanted two. 

Verdict: I would definitely go back back for more. Easily deserves 4.5 rating, maybe even a 5.
author: Chris C.

description: I love coming here for my donut craving! My favorite is the blueberry cake donut, SO YUMMY!  I still need to try their peanut butter and jelly donut. I ordered a huge order for national donut day a while ago and they were super accommodating. The day of, they were crazy busy and when I came in, I had to wait a few minutes to collect 7 boxes of donuts but everything went smoothly.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
I used to love Twisted Donuts when it first opened but my most recent visit left a bad taste in my mouth.

I ordered a dozen donut holes, 6 blueberry and 6 original glazed.

Given I came around 5:30PM closing time, I'm wasn't expecting much. The blueberry holes were fairly good, no complaints here. Would definitely order again. The glazed holes on the other hand were stale and lacking of flavor. They tasted like stale bread with a hint of glaze. In my previous visits, this was never a problem, hopefully this is a one time case.

I also believe I was overcharged for my purchase, should have been $2.50 instead of $3.50. Again, this has never happened before so this might just be an oversight for that day.

When Twisted first opened, I believe the owners worked the cash register and back area, they were very pleasant, friendly, and would always remember you. Unfortunately they weren't present during this visit. 

I'll come back the next time I'm around the area and hopefully I have a better experience.
author: Benny L.

description:
It's official! I AM A DONUT FAN! 
I grew up on only one kind of donut and that's the sugar donuts. I remember my dad buying me one of those every so often if we woke up early enough on weekends and as a result, I never was a fan of other donuts, but then I walked into twisted donuts!! Immediately when you walk in, there's an array of donuts in glass casing. There were all sorts of shapes, sizes and colors that overwhelm you but then you're brought back by the sweet smell of freshly baked goods. 

We got the bacon maple glazed, bacon/jalapeno maple glaze, cream puffs, blueberry donut, and the oreo and cookies donut which was the special for the week. 

Now whoever thought to put bacon and donuts together deserves a medal because all I wanted to do was start putting all maple syrup on all my bacon. I loved how the saltiness of the bacon combated the sweetness of the donut. I practically fought my boyfriend for the last piece of that donut. 

I LOVE LOVE LOVE the cream puffs! The cream was light and not too sweet while the bread was fluffy. I recommend you eat it right away to get it at the perfect texture. Next time I might just get a box load of those! We weren't as into the blueberry donuts as we were with our other choices. It was a little bit on the sweet side for me with the extra glazing around the donut. 

Overall, this place is a gem. The donuts are fresh, the service was great, the selection is wide, and the flavor will blow you away. Thanks for opening my stomach to a bigger variety of donuts. I'll definitely be returning to sample more of these mouth watering goods.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This is a neat donut spot. It has the classic donut shop touch, but also has a touch of modernism. I felt bad because only one lady was working when I visited, but she was hustling so thank goodness. Luckily in the morning Noriega is pretty dead and close to none of the nearby restaurants are even open yet so parking should be easy!

The donut selection is made up of traditional and unique options. I went with the former and got two cake donuts, one blueberry and one maple topped with nuts. I've never had a blueberry donut until today and I am not opposed to trying it again in the future. Both donuts were very tasty, soft, and fills you up quickly.

I like how they don't have all the fancy schmancy coffee drinks and resembles a traditional donut shop, you come here for coffee and donuts. The beverages consist of your typical juices and sodas in the fridge and hot/iced coffee. The coffee section is set up well and there was about 6 choices. All looked exotic and promising.
author: Micki H.

description: To be fair, we visited at little later in the afternoon so the selection was very limited. Seems that they try and make some unusual donut flavors~ we ordered a bacon-topped donut, a pbj one, and 2 'normal' donuts. They were all ok. Wouldn't drive out of my way to visit this shop, but fine if we were on the street passing by. Enthusiastic, friendly worker.
author: T. W.

description: Great donuts and friendly staff. Had maple donuts and they were very tasty.
author: Laurel G.

description:
Hipsters like Dynamo. Anti hipsters like Bob's. I like Twisted. Their donuts are delicious even if they're not straight out of the fryer, and they're delicious even if you take away the fancy flavors.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Donuts are fresh, light and fluffy! 

The Maple Bacon donut was so good. Decent amount of bacon pieces on top. A great combination.

The freshness of the donut won me over!
author: Kei C.

description:
Been looking for a good doughnut place in SF and I'd have to say that this place is good. Nothing fancy, although they do have what looked like a maple bacon doughnut and they had blueberry doughnuts. Haven't tried the ones from SoCal yet so I can't compare but these were good! Place is clean and the worker was super nice and friendly. I actually didn't know the difference between the small cake doughnuts and the normal big doughnuts. 

Went close to closing, around 6ish and their stuff was still good. I can only imagine how good it would be fresh! They take card but there's a $7 minimum. I didn't quite make the $7 minimum but the worker was nice enough to steer me in the direction of the $1 cake doughnuts and give me other suggestions
author: Mariel Ashley S.

description: had the maple bacon donut; it was a bit sweet for me, but i liked the maple flavor and the crispy bacon.
author: Heather F.

description: Got some scrumptious donuts this morning and I was not disappointed in anyway. Got 6 donuts and they were the best ever. I don't know what you do but they make them really good here.
author: Robert F.

description:
3.5 stars

Though slower to saturate the food(ie) scene than the now-ubiquitous cupcake shop, are inventive donut flavors the next dessert fad? I'm not sure, but the proof is in the pudding (pun intended); popping up in recent years: Dynamo is SF, Voodoo in Portland, Dough and Doughnut Plant both in NY, Top Pot in Seattle (never been, but it's been bookmarked longer than I care to admit.) Even donut chain Krispy Kreme started topping theirs with Oreos & I've seen a key lime pie or red velvet cake variety on the menu a time or two. The traditional glazed is going to have to move over & make room for these new, fun flavors. 

At Twisted Donut, the non-greasy balls of fried dough are a pretty sight; topped with sprinkles, a brightly-colored glaze, or an unconventional ingredient, they're certainly eye-catching. I ordered: 

-- bacon-topped maple donut: too much bread, not enough maple glaze, the same complaint I had about Dynamo's version. I liked Dynamo's just a little better if only for the crispier, higher-quality bacon. 
-- buttermilk bar: yum! Second only to Randy's in LA. Wish I'd gotten a second one because I had to share the one I bought! 
-- apple: did not try...& is still sitting in the box a couple days later. Very telling, as donuts don't last more than a couple hours in my household. 
-- strawberry french crueller: did not care for its spongey texture. Glaze had a nice fruity taste.
Total: $8 

Woman who helped me was very friendly. It's nice to see a sweet, smiling face when I'm buying donuts! She threw in about a half dozen glazed donut holes, which I greatly appreciated. 

Wouldn't drive to the Sunset for another batch, but I wouldn't turn away a Cap'n Crunch-topped donut if it mysteriously appeared in my kitchen.
author: Fancypants X.

description: The doughnuts were excellent! Although we got there late, the doughnuts still tasted good. The service was great and the prices are decent. Not too bad, its an average sized place. Id say 6 small tables. Definitely parking is usually hard to find so my boyfriend and i parked 1-2 blocks away. My boyfriend had the maple glazed bacon jalapeno doughnut and he said he liked it. Definitely and nice small cozy place compared to some chain restaurants.
author: Rachel V.

description:
After a full meal from one of those Asian restaurants down the street... it was definitely time for dessert and coffee (food coma)!

Here's some highlights:
(1) We found this place on yelp, and just a few blocks away. Walked in with pleasant greetings and smiles! 

(2) Okay selection - but all is good!

(3) ***MUST GET - BACON DONUT!!!!!!!
Repeat - bacon donut! Love it - sweet and salty = it was super perfect! Drools! I can't wait to go back and get some more... and next time it's a dozen, not just one.

(4) Sugar donuts: my favs. A little too much dough for me... (I like the little dough that's fluffy)

(5) Chocolate twist: can't go wrong with choc twistyyy

(6) Donut hole: Dude threw in a rainbow donut hole for free - totally  made my day! 


OVERALL - must get... repeat must get ... BACON DONUT! 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Sweet cravings will be over satisfied here!

Service: greeted upon entering, super friendly and helpful when you can't decide what to get. 

Donuts: blueberry was yummy but way too sweet for my taste but perfect with a side of milk. The blueberry concentration was overwhelming but I liked it because each bite for sure had blueberries. It was more cakey than usual, but I loved how fresh and soft it was. Crispy, fresh, and super sweet, what more can you get from a donut shop? They also had blueberry donut holes, so next time I'll have to get those! They have cool flavors such as orange creamiscle, bacon maple, oreo, pb&j and your traditional donuts.
author: Angela T.

description:
The prices went up which is normally understandable but wait....what is this $7 minimum to use a debit card...

The price raise tells me that your expenses went up and you placed some of that into the cost of your product. 

Or did they? 

Why wouldn't you do the same for your costs of using plastic? 
 
My main complaint here is I didn't want to buy half a dozen donuts and a coffee. I wanted one single awesome donut and a coffee but I'm forced to buy extras just to use my card. 

The worse part is I'm gonna eat all those f*ing donuts, no I can't resist, and now I've  wasted the whole week of gym time.

Ughhh. 1st world problems.
author: R J.

description: I love this place! The food is cheap and good. The building was clean and neat. It was empty when I was there. I tried their chocolate sprinkled doughnut and powdered doughnut. They were both pretty sweet, but not too sweet. I haven't tried their beverages so no comment on that. The staff there were nice and welcoming.
author: Annie Y.

description: If you are craving for donuts and awesome coffee...Twisted Donuts and Coffee is the place to be. Stop by for a quick sweet pick me up...they did not disappoint. Love every bite of it.
author: Bella C.

description:
Got the bacon maple donut along with the bacon jalapeno donut. Both were perfect and delicious.

The owner is very cheerful and friendly!
author: Tammy H.

description: Not great. If you want real donuts, go to uncle Benny's on Irving. They know how to make donuts. They're good when they're fresh and still good even right before closing.
author: Stephen U.

description: This place is a gem in the inner sunset.  The donuts are on the pricier side but well worth it now and then.   My son and I grab some donuts and meet his tutor there. They are very nice and accommodating.  Go see them and try there Maple Bacon Jalapeño donut.   Yum, Yum
author: Jon W.

description: New to the area for work but I loved this donut place to get coffee bacon maple donuts and variety of different coffees for a reasonible price. The lady jenny is genuinely nice.
author: Anthony M.

description:
Maple bacon YES
Fried flauta tortilla donut YES!!!l
Love the raspberry jelly and the blueberry jelly.

I really like this place. Highly recommend!!!
author: Anchovy G.

description: First day in the area and found this spot. Great food only down side is $7.00 minimum for card purchase.
author: Josh F.

description:
Was ok, nothing spectacular. 
The bacon maple is great though.
author: Arjun S.

description:
Best old fashion donut I ever had. Legit. Fluffy and airy and so good

Great customer service
