Try their maple bacon donut too!!
author: Carol Y.

description: Great local donut shop.  Fantastic and friendly service.  Great selection and surprisingly good coffee.  We are very happy Twisted is in our neighborhood. Since they opened, we have not gone anywhere else!
author: Amita R.

description: We tried a cinnamon glazed twist, a maple pecan donut, and some kind of crispy rugelach-like concoction with Nutella inside. Maple pecan was a little sweet for us, but tasty; the other two were unbelievably good. We will be back.
author: Dan C.

description:
Mmm. I think I've found my go-to donut shop. Not only do they have really fluffy, flavorful, tasty donuts, but they're a true mom-and-pop store with solid donuts. And for the prices ($0.95 cake donuts and ~$3 specialty donuts), it's hard to beat!

I ran in this morning to pick up some donuts and left with a maple bacon donut, an orange-glazed cake donut, and a chocolate-glazed peanut-topped cake donut. I also enjoyed them in that order, primarily because I prefer classic fluffy donuts to denser cake donuts. But the orange glaze was so good that if there was a classic donut with the orange glaze, I'm certain that would be my favorite. That said. The maple bacon was really good, with a real maple flavor and actual bacon pieces. As for the service, the woman behind the counter was super sweet and gave me a cup of water because I was clearly perspiring...

Based on the other photos on yelp, I presume they have some fun funky flavors as well (Cap'n Crunch and S'mores, for example) but unfortunately there were none of those when I visited. I hope to be back soon!
author: Julia N.

description: Solid donut shop. To be fair, I'm not sure what would make for a 5-star donut place for me, but I'm always happy with what I pick up at Twisted. Even at the end of the night, while the pickings are slim, the donuts still stay fresh and delicious. Service is very friendly and helpful in making recommendations :) try the buttermilk bar if you can snag one! Minimum $5 for credit cards.
author: Diana C.

description: This is a solid donut place in the Outer Sunset. My friends and I stopped here one morning for donuts and coffee before a road trip. We got iced coffees, and we loved the coffee ice cubes in them. I got a regular glazed donut and a blueberry one, and my friend got a cream-filled one. They were fresh since it was really early, and the coffee was nice and strong.
author: Steph V.

description:
The hipsters have arrived in the Outer Sunset and Twisted Donut is further proof of that. Donuts are making a huge comeback and heaven help me!!! I'm a huge donut fan since the days of Winchell's and I'm very excited about the new donut trend springing up in the Bay Area. 

Twisted is not your traditional donut store. It follows what was started by Voodoo Doughnuts in Oregon then followed by Top Pot in Seattle, Psycho Donuts in the South Bay and Dynamo Donuts in the City. Outrageous toppings and crazy flavor combos are what these donut stores offer and Twisted is no different. 

I ordered quite a few variety during my first visit. Obviously, you cannot avoid ordering the maple bacon donut or the Oreo cream. Both were gianormous and good. But what I really enjoyed was the orange glazed donut, which was delicious.

The owner was amazing. She was a one-woman show. As I was in the process of paying, one of the ovens started beeping, alerting her a new batch of goodies were ready. Embarrassingly, I was unable to resist getting something freshly baked. Anyway, she excused herself so she can remove the items from the oven. But she returned a minute later, apologized for the wait and shoved a free donut on top of my already large order...for one. 

The donuts averaged $2 each. Quite pricey, but they're huge. For example, the Oreo-cream donut can easily fulfill the sugar rush for two.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at Twisted. I would say Voodoo and Top Pot are still better. Many of the varieties at Twisted are copies of what these other donut stores already offer. Twisted would benefit by developing some more original flavors.
author: Albert L.

description:
So nice to have a small business owner whose business is one of my favorite items to consume.  

I bookmarked it ASAP when I read about Twisted Donuts In a foodie blog. Then I subconsciously suggested to hubby we go for Japanese food on Noreiga St.  As it turned out, Twisted Donuts was just across the street.   We had an early dinner.   Still an hour left before the donut shop closed.  Jay walked across the street and enter the shop.

Donuts and more donuts. I spied the one remaining maple bacon glazed donut. MINE, MINE, MINE, I'm internalizing.  

There were some unusually prepared donuts like a tortilla based one with raspberry filled.  I opted for the last maple bacon donut, a bear claw that was apple cinnamon filled, and a blueberry filled donut.  The owner tossed in a sugar donut.

Keep in mind it's passed 6pm.  Upon getting home, it was decision time.  Have a donut or wait until the next morning to consume.  

The evening won out.  I ate the sugar donut.  It was perfect.  Puffy and doughy.  

I wrapped the others in aluminum for the next day.  They tasted like they were made same day and not day old. Yummy in the tummy.
author: Shirley N.

description: Super good doughnuts! Inventive and yet has the classics covered. Very friendly service and always greeted with a smile.
author: Mike J.

description:
Possibly my favorite spot in all of San Francisco. Twisted offers great variety in their donuts and always adds fun, new flavors. The regular cake donuts are delicious and I'm always impressed with their specialty donuts.

My all time favorites are their croissants, particularly the spicy turkey/cheese with jalapeño. I'm also partial to any of their buttermilk bars. Other standard orders include cinnamon rolls, apple fritters, or bear claws. The creme puffs are great too.

They serve the best coffee in the bay, Peerless. The prices are fair and the ambiance is low key. The staff is welcoming and helpful (the owners are a delight)!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Best homemade donuts in SF by far!
I've also tried Bob's donuts i'd say this is better and/or as good for some people!
It has a fluffy less greasy texture, not too sweet glaze, perfect for personal cravings or as a group snack! 
I highly recommend trying everything when you have the chance. Buy a dozen assorted, don't leave out the maple bacon, chocolate glazed, maple bar, original glazed!
author: Grace W.

description:
Glad I found this spot! 

About the place - free wifi, small areas with tables and chairs and very clean. Has bathrooms but haven't used them. 

About the service - Jenny is SUPER NICE. I go here for coffee after my morning runs and she is so sweet! Always eager to help and put a smile on your face. 

About the food: LOTS of donuts selections OMG. I've only had the cinnamon twist so far - very good but wish it had more cinnamon. I've also had the ham, egg, cheese + jalapeño croissant and it's SO GOOD. The egg isn't scrambled it's over hard which makes the consistency really interesting and jalapeños give it a nice kick. The iced coffee is also very good, only $2.25 for a large and the ice cubes are coffee ice cubes! 

Check it out!
author: Neal B.

description:
Twisted Donuts et al. has a few tables for leisurely sipping coffee and eating donuts.

brew: peerless coffee (m. 1.75)
-"Sumatra Mandeling" medium roast, smooth, 6 blends available
eats: french crueller, orange(1.25)
-strange taste, crueller not melt in mouth, a tad old.

drips:
-fab service with a smile
3.5 stars
author: Victor G.

description: These are some bomb donuts! So many fun options for toppings and flavors, and the staff are very friendly.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Came in Sunday morning to grab a few donuts for breakfast. I'm usually a fan of custard donuts but didn't want anything too heavy so i went with the glazed blueberry cake donut and the regular sugar donut. 

The blueberry cake donut was slightly crispy on the outside and very moist inside. A bit too sweet for me and not as dense as the traditional cake donuts. But still good. Sugar donut was moist and fluffy and not too sweet as expected. Can't really go wrong with a sugar donut as long as its fresh.

Plenty of maple bacon donuts available when i came but I'm not a fan of bacon in general so i didn't care for it. But for those that come here specifically for it, i guess come by noon. 

Skimming through the yelp pics and it looks like they have cream puffs?!  Yay. I'm def gonna try that next time. oh and the chocolate custard bars.
author: Cathy M.

description:
Great donut shop in the Sunset! The lady was super friendly and really helpful when we were  asking about the different types of donuts here.

They have different types of pre-brewed coffees on the left side and have creamers in the fridge. They take credit card here but there's a $7 minimum. 

Overall, the donuts here are good and super friendly staff.

Pros:
-Great donuts
-Friendly staff

Cons:
-$7 minimum for credit cards
author: Paul U.

description:
Their maple bacon glazed donuts - delicious! I love the sweet and savory combination, and there were enough bacon that I can get some in every bite. It also wasn't too sweet.  

I also got the blueberry donut. It's more on the dense side, not fluffy like how I like my donuts so I'll probably pass on this one next time. 

The donut holes were good. Nice and fluffy, just the way i like it.  

The lady that rang me up threw in a free donut! It was filled with some kind of jam (I forgot what it was). I'm not a fan of donuts with filling but since the donut was fluffy, it was good after I scrapped off some of the filling.
author: Michelle T.

description:
They opened just last week.

Thought this place was average.
The glazed yeast-raised twisted donut wasn't as fluffy as I would like.  
The old fashioned with chocolate glaze wasn't that great.
Had the blueberry cake donut and it wasn't cakey enough for me.  Not bad though.
The lady was nice though and she gave us a free donut.
Supposedly their maple bacon is really good but it was out when I went.
author: Heejin L.

description: They have variety of donuts. My favorite is a grazed buttermilk bar, which is amazingly delicious!!
author: Megumi H.

description: This review is long overdue but I would definitely come back whenever I'm in that area. There was a tiny Asian lady, I'm guessing she's the owner, was so nice and helpful. I told her I heard good things about this place and it was my first time, so she hooked it up with extra donuts of what her favorites were. The apple turnovers were bomb. Parking isn't great (but when is it, when you're in the city?) but go early in the morning and you'll be able to find a spot lol.
author: Julla E.

description:
I have been coming here for quite a while now.  However, no more.  The last two times they didn't have what was on the menu.  Also, the donuts don't look like the photos.  That is disappointing when you have that pic in your mind and then show up and "what happened?"
The staff is nice, but not receptive when you ask them what happened to the donuts that you have listed on your menu?  Write it down and give it to your supervisor to remove! No longer lives up to its name.  Good donuts, but just like other stores.
author: Pat D.

description:
So I give a crap about Yelp and haven't yelped in forever! But when a store forces you to buy seven dollars of donuts to use a credit card...I will have to call bullshit!
They use square which is percentage based! One dollar or hundred dollars it's 2.5 percent! I go in there get two donuts and a coffee and she goes seven dollar min!?
Because we get charge for anything under 7?!?!
That is a straight up lie! You force people to buy more product with credit cards cause you want to be a cash business to hide money fine! But don't lie when I am been using square for five years!
You lost a costumer and I have been going there near day for months!
author: Konstantine A.

description: Perfect window for computer work, delicious donuts and coffee! They have tea if you're craving some steam for your Karl.
author: Sierra H.

description:
WOW, what a great first experience! I stumbled in to this shop randomly and was so surprised at how lovely this place is. The owners are super sweet and very thoughtful. They have a large variety of donut and croissant flavors as well as about six different flavors of brewed coffee. 

Surprisingly enough, this is a great place to study, too! I spent most of my afternoon here working on school stuff until they closed. 10/10 would recommend
author: Sally H.

description:
Hello donuts!

Feeling like some good ol' fashioned donuts with little twist? Look no further than this cozy mom and son operation just half a block off busy 19th ave.

Highlights include their Voodoo-inspired bacon maple, blueberry (made with fresh berries), and rotating seasonal specials. 

Good thing is their donuts aren't overly sweet, which means you can probably eat a couple extra donut holes without feeling too guilty.
author: Anthony N.

description: These donuts are so fresh and delicious! I just had a sprinkled glazed one and it tasted so good! The owner is super sweet and the simple donuts are only $1
author: Katie P.

description: The donuts here are solid. They do a great cake donut and a great yeasted donut so you really can't go wrong with any choice here. Even though I am a bit over the bacon craze, I really enjoyed their maple bacon yeasted donut. The highlight for me is on weekends when they have donut specials. Last weekend on our first visit we tried the nutty monkey and the blueberry lemonade both of which were delicious. I really enjoyed the nutty monkey because of the fresh sliced banana and nutella combo. yum. Service is really friendly and they love hearing feedback on their donuts and are interested in any recommendations for flavors or combinations that you want to see on the menu. I also love the stuffed donut pillows that decorate the interior. It'd be fun if they started to sell them as merch.
author: Alice H.

description: Though this place is not as creative as Side Car (Costa Mesa) or Donut Bar (San Diego), their offerings are true to each of the intended flavors.  I sampled the Maple Bacon and Blueberry donuts.  Both were delicious!  The raised donut of the Maple Bacon was light and airy, with a slight chew.  The maple glaze was subtle and did not overpower the delicious and crispy bacon.  The Blueberry donut tasted as if fresh blueberries were just inserted into the cake base.  Yum, yum!
author: Gene D.

description:
Don't be fooled by chunks of bacon on top of donuts and four and a half stars -- Twisted Donuts is not nearly as good as it looks on Yelp. 

I had bookmarked the shop weeks ago after my boyfriend moved nearby and was really excited to go in this morning. We tried the maple bacon, a glazed French cruller and a chocolate classic donut. Honestly, they didn't taste much better than Safeway donuts. I won't be going back.
author: Elena K.

description:
This is my first 5-star review. It's very very rare that I would choose to give someone a perfect score. I mean there's always a flaw and nothing is really perfect, but this place really is! Not only is the taste a 5, the customer service is a 5 too! 

I came here yesterday thinking I could finally try this place after driving by it when it was still under construction. I saw the sign for the weekend special hoping there would be blueberry donut holes, but I was sad to see that most of the donuts were sold out and all that was left was the original glazed, one cream cheese croissant, and cinnamon rolls. This was around 5pm. My friend and I decided to try the original glazed, and what do you know? It was better than Krispy Kreme! We'll that is, if you like it a bit more chewy. KK is very soft and like cotton candy, gone in a bite. Not only was this donut soft, it had a chewy texture, I knew I had to try the blueberry donut holes, so I got up early today and went right when it was opened.

I was only planning to get the blueberry donut holes, but then I ended up getting so much more! I decided to try all the weekend specials. Normally I don't like salty and sweet mixed together, but I read so many reviews about the maple bacon that I decided to try the baconpeno. The lady was very nice and offered me a sample to make sure it wasn't too spicy for me! BEWARE: May be spicy for those who can't handle spicy. I asked her what the PB and J donut was cause I wasn't too sure how they made it, but she said a customer said it was so good that she had to make more. I don't even eat PB&J sandwiches, but everything she said seemed to be good, so I thought I should try it. The last special was the cream puffs. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much, so I only got a few to try. BUT omg the moment I bit it, I was dying for more. I really should've got so much more!!! It's so soft and chewy! Not like your normal layered puffy cream puffs. Might be more cream than you think in the puffs, so let her know I you want less! Lastly, I wanted more of the original, but I wasn't sure if the donut holes tasted the same, so she quickly offered me a sample! And so I decided to get a dozen donut holes....

I saw a review about how it was but 6, get 6 free on Saturdays and mentioned it to her, as apparently that was only the grand opening special :( but she quickly gave me a free donut!! 

The lady who works there's is super nice and friendly! If you wanted to sample anything, I'm pretty sure she wouldn't mind :) The only thing I would change is that I wished they have me everything in a box instead because I ended carrying over 5 of those white paper bags. They're not that thick and most of them already soaked through :/ but that's not a big issue! I would definitely come here much more often and recommend it to my friends! And I'm even willing to wake up for it LOL (I hate waking up early)

Tip: Come early! Most are gone by 5 :/
Credit with a $7min
Store hours: M-F 6am Weekends 7am (I think it alway closes at 7, but I'm not too sure. If anything, give them a call before you head out to see what's left! )

Beware: You could go in thinking you'll only buy/try one, but you'll walk out with a dozen!
author: Tina P.

description: I just moved to the Noriega area in the Sunset and decided to try Twisted and was so impressed! Their selection is solid and the golden sprinkles donut I tried was heavenly. They also have free WiFi which is always a plus!
author: Genevieve H.

description:
Hidden gem in the sunset!! I came by after my night shift at a hospital down the street (at about 7:45am on a Saturday) and decided to buy some morning treats for the family. Wasn't busy at all yet. Jenny served me and she was so nice! As soon as I walked in, I was impressed with the cleanliness and of course the display of variety of donuts!

Couldn't resist getting the fancy looking ones: a couple maple bacon raised, an oreo-chocolate glazed bar, and a cap'n crunch topped raised donut (this may have been a Saturday special, since it wasn't in the  glass case with the rest of em--it had its own tray with a lid on the counter). All of them tasted as good (or even better) than they looked!

Needless to say, the donuts are amazing and I have found my new favorite donut spot to go to after work! Thanks Twisted for your creativity and yummy creations! Can't wait to come back to see what else they'll come up with.
author: Veronica N.

description:
I had a disappointing experience this morning at twisted. I ordered 5 doughnuts and two "white mocha frappé" totaling close to $20. When we got our white mocha frappe that cost $4.75 the taste was just blended ice ,milk and white mocha powder. No espresso shots or coffee in it at all. Apparently the espresso is already mixed in the white mocha powder. (If your going charge top price you should serve at top quality) 
 When my girlfriend and I politely asked for an ice latte instead of the (white chocolate ice milk ) drink we ordered, the lady working there become very upset. We explained that it was just not a drink we would enjoy, we were just hoping for a blended ice drink with espresso in it. As the lady became upset we begin to feel very uncomfortable. 
 Thankfully the younger guy working understood how we felt and had good customer service and made us a coffee drinking we could enjoy.  But as he was making the lattes the older lady working there told her coworker not to pour us new espresso shots and us the shots she poured over 10 minutes ago telling us they were still hot. (That alone shows the lack of coffee training at this shop). The lady then started huffing and puffing and mumbling under her breath well shaking her head and staring at us well we waited for new drinks. It was very uncomfortable and unprofessional.  
   I've worked and trained baristas in 3 different coffee shops in San Francisco. I've trained baristas about the importance of not letting espresso shots sit and become bitter. never serve a Customer old shots and make sure they leave happy. I was so disappointed with this place I decided to write my first yelp review about it. Because I feel other people who are willing to spend a good amount of money on coffee and donuts should know what they are getting in to. I haven't even tried the doughnuts yet because I started writing this review instead.
author: Julia P.

description: This is the only donut place I like. I won't go anywhere else. Nothing else to say.... oh wait, yes there is. If you like chocolate with sprinkles, you gotta get there before noon/early afternoon. They usually run out by the evening.
author: Karen L.

description: Gimmicky. Really just plane donuts with different sugar coating. Not worth the drive.
author: Andrea K.

description:
I opened the Twisted Donuts box and gazed at the gems of glistening glaze looking back at me. There was genuine joy as I bit into the first one. That joy curdled immediately as the powerful taste of old vegetable oil coated my tongue. 
My next thought was "There's something not right about this bite..." I peeked at the donut and realized that the dough was still raw inside! 
Donuts are a rare treat for me - to be thoroughly disappointed by a place with rave reviews leaves a bad taste in my mouth that almost matches the oily film left from that first bite. 
There is a box with five donuts sitting on my counter... I don't even want to try them.
All I can say in defense of Twisted Donuts and Coffee is that the service was very good. The donuts themselves look beautiful, but that just made the terrible taste all the more disappointing.
author: Gabriela B.

description: Very nice and friendly staff not to mention their amazing strawberry cream cheese croissant. No wonder why they sell out so fast.
author: April Rose C.

description:
Jalapeno on a ham/turkey and cheese croissant, so simple, so brilliant.

The owner is bright and cheery.

Beware, you may run into Yelpers who are looking to boost their foodie credentials by harshly judging a donut store.
author: James Y.

description: The baconpeño doughnut & fruitritos are bomb!
author: Matt L.

description: This is a great local spot for your morning sweet tooth. I loved the Mom & Pop feel along with creative thought at this place. During the NBA playoffs, they sold Warriors style blue and gold donuts - very cute! All I have tried as been very good - from the classics (chocolate creme filled donuts and apple fritters) to maple bacon donuts, they have a really great assortment. Neighbors with Home cafe, you're close to some good coffee as well. :)
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
Craving for evil sweetness in a random afternoon 
I buy 3 and get 1 for free for a taste, nice! 
Maple glaze bacon donut: 
Savory, sweet... I love this combination
Orange sprinkle cake: 
It's a cake, but light and fluffy. Love the orange glaze 
Pink strawberry French cruller: 
Compare to other donut shop I usually go, this cruller isn't airy and fluffy enough. But this is tasty still because the glaze
Blueberry donut with sugar glaze:
Oh...my.... It's good!!! Crispy sugar glaze and full of blueberry. Amazing, my fav!!!

Overall, their glaze are all delicious! Nice flavored. 

Just cannot believe I finish all 4 by myself in 30min 
This is how you tell they r delicious!
author: JustinE Y.

description: I wish I found this place before my wedding for my donut tower.  In retrospect, it's probably a good thing because being in the Sunset area, I probably would have ruined my wedding diet regimen by going here everyday. I specifically come here for the blueberry donuts.  I cannot get enough of them.  Plus the owners and staff are great and know how to make a customer feel welcomed.
author: Anna Lisa P.

description: So glad I found this gem while visiting SF! It's unbelievably delicious! I got the last one of the maple bacon and peanut butter jelly and they were both amazing! My kids loved every bite of it! If you live around the area or is visiting SF, you have to come here to get some donuts! You will not be disappointed!
author: Annie T.

description: Stumbled upon this spot while dropping my car off for some work. The place smelled so delicious we had to stop in! Right off the bat, their customer service was phenomenal! (it's why I decided to review them). The person working,who I am assuming is the owner,made us feel at home. We got the cinnamon bun, a long john, and a Pb&J glazed donut sandwich. My god they were awesome. I'm not usually in this neighborhood but next time I am you best believe I will be back!
author: Willie M.

description: If you're looking for a nice place to relax with some great donuts come to Twisted Donuts! This looks like a place where you can get some work done on your laptop. The owner is hella friendly and welcoming. The donuts were delicious, I'm not sure if they have more variety since I have only been once. Parking is also a hassle with the meter maids across the street. The wifi was pretty good too. This is the best donut shop I know in the Sunset District.
author: Dan G.

description: I've been craving for some donuts for quite some time and what better way to satisfy my cravings than at Twisted! Came here for a breakfast croissant and their yummy glazed blueberry cake donuts. The customer service here was great. As soon as I walked inside, I was greeted by a friendly and cheery woman, who helped me immediately and was attentive to my needs. Thank you so much for the wonderful experience, I will be coming back again soon for the PB&J donuts!
author: Kass L.

description: Such a cute place!!!! Finally something new in the neighborhood that is casual fare! I hope this place stays.  I just wanted a taste and got the blueberry donut. I was surprised at how soft/fluffy the donut was. I expected something dense, but it was uber light. It was not too sweet and it had great blueberry flavor. My only hesitation is cost, just because donuts are generally not known to be expensive. I would not say that this place is a "hipstery" donut place like VooDoo or Dynamo Donut that would justify an added cost. Just my thoughts!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Good donuts and friendly staff.

The Maple Bacon Donut was awesome and super fresh. The citrus pound donut was great and so was the cinnamon roll donut. Nice addition to the avenues.

I find it funny that people on yelp complaining about them having a minimum on CC of $7 which is not a lot.. Here is an idea carry some f#$%&ng cash.
author: Michael W.

description:
I feel bad.  I talked this place up to my husband (since it had good reviews) and good donut places are hard to come by where we live.  We went there on a Friday morning and it was not terribly busy.  I thought it was because we missed the "going to work rush" being on vacation and all but perhaps it was another reason.

We got the blueberry, apple fritter, chocolate long john, maple bacon and apple "burrito."  I don't eat maple or bacon but my husband said it was "not very good."  The burrito I had one bite of and could not take it. Something about the glaze turned my stomach.  My husband ended up tearing chunks of it off (not sure what that was about) but finished it.

I love chocolate long johns and found this one lacking.  There is a lot of dough but not a lot of chocolate to back it up.  And what chocolate there is has little to no flavor.

The apple fritter and the blueberry donuts were delish so maybe the cake donuts are better than the dough/yeast ones?  We sat next to a very interesting lady who talked to herself, and made comments about people who came in.  Also the one and only bathroom was occupied the whole time we were in there....

Employees were nice and friendly. Answered questions and were patient while we made decisions.  They accept credit cards but use Square (which I am not fond of since my CC number was stolen from Square) so I would bring cash or pay with a CC not a debit card.

Probably won't return and my hunt for good donuts will be continued.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Delicious donuts! Those blueberry donut holes. Yum! And the maple bacon donut... wow. Also, the lady who took our order is super nice. We definitely enjoyed our first time at Twisted Donuts. Definitely going back!!!
author: Cindy V.

description: The staff was amazingly nice and she gave me 2 blueberry donut holes to try. I purchased maple bacon, maple bacon jalapeño, pumpkin fritter, glazed twisted, cinnamon crumb twisted, a cream puff, and a peanut butter and jelly. All good. I'd go again.
author: Nani S.

description: Brought these unique donuts to an office party and everyone loved it! The jalapeño bacon one was the most talked about. Cashiers were great and helpful too
author: Louise C.

description: Solid donuts and great service, but nothing out of this world. I would go back if I was nearby.
author: Mariah N.

description:
I came on a Monday with my bestfriend for the first time excited to try twisted donuts. It was a good time because we were able to get 3 donuts for the price of one! (I guess they only do that on Mondays)

Now I got a regular sugar donut with strawberry glaze and a cinnamon sugar twist, which were really fresh and delicious. Even though they seemed sweet they weren't overly sweet which I liked. They dough was very fluffy and fresh tasting. My bestfriend got the blueberry and a raspberry filled donut, which she loved as well. Now she's very picky and she loved both. I tried her blueberry one and it tasted just like a blueberry muffin! I love how they use real blueberries in those. 

Big plus on how clean and friendly they are.

I will be back for sure!
author: Nicole V.

description:
Great little place right off 19th Ave on my way to work.

Super friendly and great service. 

Maple bacon doughnut was amazing. Made my day. 

I'll be back soon. Like... Tomorrow.
author: Brian H.

description: Great service and great food. I was able to happily study while munching on my food.
author: Amy L.

description:
would give 5 stars for the donuts.
4 stars because their mocha was meh.... the milk was definitely burnt, i could smell and taste it. But sweet staff, they greeted me right as I walked in. 

The bacon donut (with jalapenos if you want) is a must. 
The cream puffs, not to be confused with the donut holes, are a MUST MUST!! fyi they're $.50 each.
kruellers are nomally my favorite type of donut but theirs seemed kinda old and stale :/ 
The ham,cheese, and jalapeno croissant was good too!
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Ok - it's official!  I have a new favorite donut shop - Twisted Donuts & Coffee.

The shop is clean, friendly and convenient, but most importantly the donuts are fresh baked on site.

I have not had an apple fritter this fresh since Kingpin donuts at midnight in Berkeley, but my mind was blown by the blueberry donut. You have to try the blueberry donut. 

YOU HAVE TO TRY THE BLUEBERRY DONUT!

If you like donuts, run, don't walk, to Twisted Donuts & Coffee.
author: Cary W.

description:
You won't get super conceptual deconstructed donuts with epicurean ingredients here. This is not a dynamo (or Voodoo for Portlanders). 

What you will get is a wide variety of extremely well made donuts. These aren't stuffed full of fake sugar or soggy with fat like  those at other popular spots. Try the filled glazed and the cake. 

+ 1/2 star for the cheerful owner
+ 1/4 star for having multiple blueberry options
+ 1/4 star for the French students doing magic tricks while waiting for their order.
author: Andrew F.

description: Sold out by 5:30 and open until 7pm! You fxxing kidding me. I drive all the way there and only to waste my time. You can look at it like its not their fault be at the same time it is. When you have a sweet tooth and want some dough nuts, travel all the way there only to see they didn't prepare enough doughnuts is the same as bad service. Here's a tip, it better to make more and waste money than it is to piss people off. You need to spend money to make money. Stop being so cheap!
author: Keit K.

description:
We just moved to sunset and obviously had to try some of these donuts! 
I decided to walk there to try to burn off some of the inevitable calories. 
I tried the maple bacon, a Halloween themed one, and blueberry. Well, I tried half of each of those, although that was difficult... Because they are so good! I think because I was there before 9, everything was delicious and fresh. 
The Halloween themed one actually had an almost orangey, tangerine flavor to it! So fun and good.
Loved it and will definitely visit again... Very dangerous with how close this is to us...
author: Margaret M.

description:
Decided to stop by and check this place out. Greeted right when I walked in. Nice assortment of donuts! Owners and workers are very friendly. Got a free donut cause she said that it looked ugly, but it looked and tasted great. 

5 stars!!
author: Brian L.

description:
This place is simply awesome. Jenny and the rest of the staff are super friendly. The donuts are amazing as are the savory croissants. It's one of those places I want to succeed so that we continue to have this little treasure in our neighborhood but don't necessarily want to become too popular that it loses its local charm. But, that said, you need to go. 

They're known for their maple bacon donut but everything they have is good so don't limit yourself. The cream puffs on the weekend are amazing - definitely get a few of those in addition to your order. They keep well, too, so you can save them for dessert. 

As a bonus, the coffee is good, too. They have Peerless. For their iced coffee (large and cheap) they use coffee ice cubes so it doesn't get watered down. 

Monday's are buy 3 get one free. 

They take credit cards using Square with a $7 minimum.
author: Greg Z.

description:
So happy to have stumbled upon this place during an impromptu tour of the Sunset: Wonderful Dessert and Cafe (Durian smoothie. 'Nuff said), Fujiyama-Ya Japanese Restaurant (because: Sushi), and Twisted Donuts. Yeah. Dessert TWICE! That's how we roll (Don't judge, we earned it after a 6 mile walk along the beach).

We tried the old fashioned (donut, not what South Park made up), the bacon maple, the blueberry cake, and the cream puffs. All were good. The surprise of the trip were the cream puffs, they were the clear favorites. I'm looking forward to coming back.
author: Jose U.

description: I love this place. It's 2 blocks from my house which is really awesome too. The employees are super friendly and helpful. Most of their stuff is really good, but I'm slightly disappointed by their apple fritters which is usually my go-to pastry. Also, they run out of pretty much everything by around 1 PM everyday, which I think is definitely a flaw in their business. I'd gladly buy donuts from them in the middle of the day, so I think this causes them to lose a lot of money.
author: Graham S.

description:
I like this place! We stumbled upon it while heading to the bank, and the little guy ran into the shop without even asking.  They were promoting their maple bacon donut outside, so that was intriguing already.

We decided why not let's give it a shot, ordered July 4th themed chocolate donut with sprinkles, donut holes, and the maple bacon donut. 

The maple donut was off the hook !!!! That will give you 5 starts right off the bat.  The rest of the donut was just OK.  I'm sure if I came first thing in the morning the donuts would be amazing.  The consistency looked to be there, but I'd have to really try it in the morning to know that it's really bomb.  

I'll be back! I'm sure I'll pick up a dozen for the office soon 

 out!
author: Jorlyn W.

description: I  been coming here every morning (sorry house of coffee! you need to step it up.) I try really hard to avoid the donuts and go straight to their delicious coffees; I'm looking at you dark french roast. Jenny, the owner, is super sweet and loves to chat up a storm. Sometimes, she throws in extra donut holes when I do buy a donut. That donut is always their chocolate one. So yummy and fluffy. Ok, it's heaven sent. Everything looks yummy..They got maple bacon, orange, strawberry, glazed..etc I bought a jalepeno turkey and cheese croissant here once and it was incredible. Call in if you are in a rush and she'll have it ready for you.
author: Kelly C.

description: This place is really good. I love the flavors and all the donuts are freshly made. The employees are very nice and helpful. Got to try their bacon maple jalapeño donut which was actually pretty good. One recommendation is to go there before afternoon since they run out of the nice donuts really fast in the morning. One little thing is that their donuts are pretty pricey, specially the special flavor ones.
author: H C.

description:
Great new spot on Noriega. Since the menu has such a variety of unique flavors, I asked what they recommended which was the Bacon Maple jalapeño  doughnut. I had to choose hesitantly since it was such a weird combo but as the risk taker I am I ended up getting one. And so glad I did because it was super tasty! The maple and bacon really compliment each other and the jalapeño gives it a nice kick without overpowering it. I definitely recommend it if you're up for trying.

I also bought one of the blueberry doughnuts. This one tasted like a glazed blueberry pancake. Very nice for a morning snack. 

They have many more goodies that I'm going to try next time.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Love this place.  It's super clean!  

Cream puffs oh my.  Drool...

I only wish they had more of the specialty doughnuts, but I understand folks buy them early and often.

This place is what it is and what it should be a Donut and Coffee shop.
author: Kelson H.

description: I found Twisted Donuts thanks to Yelp and was pleasantly surprised! The coffee wasn't anything to write home about but the woman working the counter was very friendly. I ordered a medium coffee and got a large for no extra cost, and then she gave me a cream puff for free with my delicious maple bacon donut! The decor of the place was also cute and it was nice that the cafe wasn't packed with people. I would definitely go back here again.
author: Grace C.

description: Customer service is on point, beverages are excellent, and donuts are exotic. Definitely a gem in the neighborhood.
author: Paula I.

description:
Such a friendly atmosphere! 

The owner was such a sweetheart, she offered my boyfriend & I samples of her orange sprinkle & blueberry donut (both of which were delicious!) 

We stopped by because we wanted the bacon maple donut, but since it was later in the afternoon there was only 1 left. We ended up with some of the raspberry filled, chocolate glazed, cinnamon sugar and some other complementary donuts. 
She even gave us the leftover sample for the blueberry donut. 

Overall this is definitely a place I'll be coming by more often before work!
author: Maribel E.

description:
Located in a quiet neighborhood on a short stretch of a retail block with decent parking. I am pretty sure the woman who helped us was the owner--super friendly and welcoming. :)

Cute shop with a few tables inside for enjoying your treats in-store. Clean bathroom.

We took our doughnuts and drove a few minutes north to enjoy them at Ocean Beach. You're also close to Golden Gate Park, if you prefer a more green doughnut eating atmosphere. ;)

I ordered the coconut. My husband ordered the jalapeno bacon maple and Bavarian cream. We also split an orange-glazed with sprinkles. We were both very happy with our choices. The doughnuts were fresh and moist. I usually order coconut doughnuts at any doughnut shop I go to, and this was one of the best I've had--no artificial flavors and a perfect doughnut crumb. The orange-glazed also had no fake flavor. Both were perfectly sweet. Yum!

Even though we went later in the morning, there were plenty of tasty-looking options. If I wasn't on sugar-overload from all the goodies I'd already crammed in my mouth on this trip, I would have picked up a sugar twist or yeast-raised doughnut, too.
author: Lesley C.

description:
This place is simply amazing. Wide selection of unique and delicious donuts.

Maple bacon donuts. Jalapeño flavor. Chocolate fill fried tortilla with powdered sugar something. Yummy cream puffs.

And all very cheap!

It's absolutely worth the trek to come out here. You won't regret it :)
author: Tyler C.

description:
This place is starting to become my daily place for coffee. They offer friendly service and a variety of coffee you can choose from. I normally get the hazelnut coffee and it taste pretty good. They even have ice coffee with coffee ice cube so that the drink will not be watered down.

Based on the name this place gotta have some different types of donuts compared to your normal ones. The one that I particularly like is the maple bacon donut. It's sweet yet savory taste will get your taste buds going. Did I mention that they have very cheap donut holes!?!? 

If you haven't tried this place, why not give it a try. Maybe you will enjoy how twisted their donuts are.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Very cool place with excellent donuts. I love their ice coffee. While it is not cold brewed (like Hollow on Irving), it comes poured over frozen coffee ice cubes. Great idea. 
The specialty donuts are often over the top, but if you're into that, you won't be disappointed. I have not tried the bacon donut. I always go for the standard donut fare selection, and they do this very well.
I wish they had an organic milk choice, but Berkeley Farms is decent and its local.
The person who is usually working when I visit is always very nice and pleasant. She projects an excellent image for the shop. Enjoy this little Sunset splurge. It's a treasure.
author: Mosey S.

description:
I grew up on 21st Ave. There's always been the Chinese bakery on Noriega. They always had alright morning pastries. I usually made the trek down to Safeway on 30th if I was dying for a donut.
Finally after almost 30 years of waiting! The sunset gods placed this amazing shop in my life. The donuts are delicious. The coffee is tasty and the people working there are nothing but inviting and warm. I'd give this place 10 stars if I could just because my prayers have finally been answered! Haha
author: Steven T.

description:
Twisted Donuts and Coffee may be my new favorite donut place to go to.

== Food ==

I bought a bunch of donuts to bring home to my family. They were:

Blueberry donut holes, a twist, a regular glazed donut, and maple bacon donut. Sadly, the maple bacon donut was swiped from me by a family member. I got to tr everything else though. The glazed and twist donuts were amazingly moist and soft. It tasted like freshly baked donuts with all the fluffiness. The blueberry donut holes were also delicious. Alas, the maple bacon... I'll come back for you.

== Service ==

The lady was amazingly helpful and kind. She pointed out the popular donuts and gave a free sample of the blueberry donut hole. After paying, she gave me a free donut! Amazing service!

== Overall ==

I bought too many donuts and couldn't finish it. Surprisingly, the donuts were still moist and soft after a couple of days. That's quality donuts there. Totally like this place.
author: Steven B.

description:
The more I try their regular doughnuts, the more disappointed I am. The doughnuts are heavy and just sit in my stomach through lunch. On weekdays, there's nothing out of the ordinary in their doughnut cases, it's the usual stuff you can find pretty much anywhere for way cheaper.

I only come in for the blueberry doughnut holes and PB&J now. On many occasions I've found both items on weekdays as I only come on my way to work. I was informed that PB&J was a weekend item the last time I came in, so I ended up getting a regular doughnut that was disappointing. Today I went in asking for blueberry doughnut holes and was informed for the first time that it was another weekend item. The 5-6 times I've been here since opening they've had it, so I was confused. My husband has been here on weekdays and got the doughnut holes as well. I was told that someone may have special ordered the items and they had left overs. Great. I was asked if I wanted the blueberry cake doughnut, but I declined. I left disappointed and empty handed. I didn't want to be further disappointed by another one of their ordinary doughnuts. I don't get why these "special" items that are the standout out of all your doughnuts are sold two days a week. 

Sadly, I don't think I will be visiting very often. I have way better breakfast options on weekends than overpriced doughnuts.
author: Adelina W.

description: Was so happy to find a place like this in outer sunset! Friendly staff, a solid selection of donuts, and a laid back atmosphere. Prices aren't bad, great way to start a gluttonous morning!
author: Marilyn M.

description: Nice place to visit when you need a sweet treat and you're waiting for your car's oil to get changed on 19th. Awesome selection of flavors (though I believe they update/change availability pretty regularly). The lady who helped me was so nice! Great to visit also when you're just wanting old fashioned doughnuts versus the krispy kreme - type.
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
Homer Simpson says it best MMMMMMM Donuts.  I walked in towards the late afternoon I think all the fancy donuts were all sold out as the selection was limited.  Bought two classics, a sugar donut and a glazed twist as well as a hot chocolate and a coffee.  A little over $5 not the cheapest but reasonable.  Excellent service, the woman who helped me was all smiles and very helpful which is refreshing.  

The sugar donut was so soft and fluffy with a slight chew.  It was just right how a sugar donut is supposed to be dusted in just the right amount of sugar.  The glazed twist donut, I have had many over my lifetime and it was shockingly moist.  I would probably say the moistest donut I ever had.  Hot chocolate was nice and sweet, not watered down.  Coffee was good, not burned and strong enough to compliment the donut.

I'm definitely gonna twist again @ twisted donuts and coffee.
author: Grubnoisseur Y.

description:
Very, very disappointed.

I was hoping for a Dynamo Donuts West and what I got was just another crappy Sunset donut shop like Dirty Bennys.

I tried the bacon donut. Nothing like the Dynamo one. My guess is that they are using grocery store bacon. Bleh.

Awful crowd. It's Noriega after all. The beige jacketed dirty old man outside with his finger in his nose didn't help the ambiance. So much hacking and spitting going on that I suggest you take your donuts home or to Golden Gate Park or something.

Will NOT return.
author: Chuck G.

description:
Really tasty donuts with some unique offerings like maple bacon jalapeño. I often bring these to work to treat my colleagues and they all rave about it. Only reason I don't go there all the time is I don't need the extra calories. 

Super nice owner. Definitely give them a try and support our local small businesses.
author: M Y.

description:
I'm glad I lived to have had the raised glazed donut.  It was perfect in every way.  10 seconds at 20% power in the microwave, uh huh, uh huh!

Wish I bought 2, but my waistline is happy I didn't.

Not wanting to be tempted, I did not look into the display case.  That will be my next visit, which will be after Easter!   

How I will long for another bite!
author: Debbie T.

description: Great donuts and super service. Great local donut shop. The bacon maple donuts are addictive. The shop feels happy! Coffee selection is excellent.
author: Maggie H.

description: Saw this place when I was across the street at Homes Coffee! Looked at the pictures on yelp and decided to try! The staff are extremely friendly and so nice! Reasons why I would come back. Also their donuts looked good! I was very full so I didn't get a donut. I got their doughnut holes, the cake ones. They had sprinkle, powder sugar, and blueberry doughnut holes. VERY Delicious! I was impressed. Also their cream puffs are so good! I got two! The owner is so sweet. She's the little sweet lady there, I think she was the owner. But anyways. Their service was very pleasant. Which is always a must! They had a jalapeño maple donut and a s'mores donut that looked delicious. Too bad I don't live in the city! Defiantly a must try!
author: Sam C.

description: Very nice place! Friendly service and fun donut options. I've heard the ice coffee is amazing! Highly recommend the glaze donut and glazed old fashioned.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Don't get it twisted - this new donut shop on 19th avenue is here to stay. Do-nut wait to stop by though!

PRICE _ (5/5)
The prices of the donuts are on par with any regular donut shop. I can get my usual dozen donut holes for $2.00 (that's about 15 cents for a single bite of sugary deliciousness) & get a cup of coffee to finish it off.

FOOD _ (5/5)
Typical donut store with your wide variety of donuts: powdered sugar, glazed, apple fritters, donut holes, blueberry donut, croissants, etc. You'll be able to achieve that sugar high with absolutely no problem.

SERVICE _ (5/5)
Awesome service! My roommate and I walked in and found out it was their second day open. Joyce asked us how we were doing and proceeded to give us a few free samples. Both of us knew her real secret agenda was getting us addicted to the sugary bites of heaven -- but honestly, we didn't care.

AMBIANCE _ (5/5)
Plenty of seating, well-lit, and free-wifi.

PARKING _ (4/5)
No lot, but plenty of metered street parking. It is near Golden Island though, so meters might be scarce during Friday and Saturday nights.

TL;DR _
Donuts are so good, but so bad. Now that there's a new donut shop two blocks from my place, this is probably the worst best thing that's ever happened to me. Stop by and buy a donut (or two) and you'll probably find me in line satisfying my addiction to glazed donuts.
author: Daniel S.

description: What a great little donut place. The owner is just delightful in the mornings, which is a rarity! Couldn't decide, so bought 5 donuts: Blueberry, strawberry crueler, regular glazed crueler, glazed donut, maple bacon, and she threw in 5 glazed donut holes for FREE. Wow, the blueberry is amaze balls and so is the maple bacon! All the donuts were light and fluffy but the two mentioned stood out the best. Will definitely be coming back to taste new flavors!
author: Ny H.

description:
I'm not a big fan of donuts (gotta watch the waistline) and usually don't eat it, but I stumbled upon Twisted while waiting for my mom. 
I got a half dozen of the blueberry donut holes and the worker threw in an extra. I ate one and it was really moist and not overly sweet. The rest ended up in my dad's waistline :)

The people working there were really nice. I'd come back again if I have an occasional donut craving.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Generally donuts give me two emotions. 1. This doughnut is freaking delicious and 2. I shouldn't have eaten that doughnut. 

I had the apple fritter here (big-brown-doughy-sugary-glazed-fried thing) and after experiencing number 1, number 2 isn't happening. 

Five stars.
author: Steve K.

description:
Cute neighborhood shop. 

The service is always friendly and the donuts fresh (even toward the end of the day when random donut cravings have to be satisfied).  

They've got an good mix of traditional and fun trendy flavors like Maple Bacon Jalepeno (which is really tasty when warmed up). My favorite thing about this place is that all the fluffy style donuts have a lovely airiness. Reminiscent of Krispy Creme but better because Twisted donuts have a more substantial bite/chewiness.
author: Jeany K.

description: Great place with chill vibes. The customer service is really friendly and very welcoming. Even though it's not the best doughnut I've had in my life it's still a fantastic shop. (I don't really eat doughnuts).  The coffee was amazing and I love supporting local small businesses
author: Austin L.

description:
Donut get it twisted.  Twisted's donuts are yum!

Sometimes I forget how much I love donuts, and then a place like Twisted opens, and I just cannot get them out of my head.  Here are what I especially love about this place:

- Service: so friendly!  And if you're lucky, you'll sometimes be gifted with an extra donut (or two!)
- Quality: you can taste the freshness of these donuts.  They're light and airy, particularly the donut holes, which are my fav
- Variety: not just run of the mill corner coffee shop offers, but not hoity-toity hipster, either.  Twisted offers the typical classics in addition to maple bacon, s'mores galore, berry berry good, and blueberry! 

Apple Fritters are pretty tasty, too.  Mostly crunchy, the fritters are not heavy nor oily, but they could use a little more cake and slightly less crunch.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Mel T.

description: Yummy!  Place was dead on an early Sunday evening but they still had the BACON donut.  Wow, saved that for the bf, I had a cream puff and a bite of the sugar donut, both delicious!!
author: C L.

description:
I normally don't eat too many donuts because it's bad for my diet... But when I do I go all out! Stopped by over the weekend and tried:
-blueberry donut holes - YUM!!
- old fashioned 
- cinnamon cake donut - yum!
- chocolate bar donut
- croissant - HUGE
-regular donut holes - free! 
My faves were the yums mentioned above, the rest were good too pretty standard donuts.  Service was great and I'll definitely    be back. Support local!
author: Julie F.

description:
Clean, awesome service, quiet. 

Doughnuts: soft, fresh, airy and fluffy. Not super sweet which is a major *thumbs up*! We tried specials- Nutter butter & cream puffs

The woman whom I think it's an owner was really sweet, funny and walked us through flavors and what people like. 

I live a a couple blocks out of the way but it's really good! 

Also had almond milk options!
author: Shivonne T.

description: Really like their donuts,but they often run out of donuts because they are so popular. They need to adjust for the weekends and make more donuts, but they don't and their supply is depleted by early afternoon, which is extremely frustrating when I drive out there and there is nothing to buy. How do they stay in business? They will lose customers if they do not keep up with supply and demand.
author: Chester L.

description:
Aww first off, the lady there is SO nice.

The donuts are also very fresh, and I gotta say, the blueberry donut holes are BOMB DOT COM. I only get my blueberry donuts from the famous M&M Donuts in SoCal, but it's usually a 2-hr wait ): I've tried other places too to try to get a replacement spot for my beloved blueberry donuts, but they've always disappointed. 

THIS PLACE THOUGH. I'm so happy to have found a place for BOMB blueberry donuts! 

I will come backkk and order like 100 donut holes. or 100 donuts. Actually both. She might as well just make 100 donuts but leave the donut holes in...thanks in advance! ;)

Ohh I also tried the maple and bacon donut but it was a bit too sweet for me...but you guys, don't even look at anything other than the blueberry donuts.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Just another chinese-run donut shop? Think again!

The nice lady that runs this store is sweeter than her blueberry donuts... that came out wrong. 

But speaking of blueberry donuts, those things are bomb. On the weekends she turns them into holes. Her iced coffee is the best, she even adds coffee ice cubes! Neat!

So two college kids with two donuts each, two small coffees, and lots of extra freebies (she treats us right) comes out to under $5. 

What a steal. I feel like I'm taking advantage of this woman and her blueberry donut holes.
author: Tiffy D.

description:
Donuts before dinner?  Why not?  I stopped in before heading across the street to meet my parents for dinner.  I'm not a big donut eater so I went with the basics.  Glazed, old fashion and the blueberry which was recommended by the staff.

My husband liked the glazed but you really can't go wrong with that.  Maple old fashion was good.  Although I did enjoy the blueberry one which was cakey like the old fashion, my husband passed when I offered him half of my half.  

Prices were a little steep for ordinary, not extraordinary donuts.  But then again I never buy them so over $1 for one seemed like too much.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Everything was incredible.  I can't wait to come back.  The team is so friendly and the place is clean.  I am an early riser, and getting their in the early is key to avoid any rush.  Weekends I'm told can be challenging there if you're not in before 9AM, so be warned.  Haters can whine about price and etc, but quality and good service is worth it.  Because Bacon Jalapeño Maple Donut!!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Super nice staff. Super super nice. They had a minimum on credit cards when I went so I asked if I could just buy enough donuts to meet it (I only wanted one donut but didnt have cash but I really wanted one of their blueberry donuts) and the lady and dude were really nice to accomodate me. I was a couple cents under the minimum but they let it go because I already had like more than five donuts for myself. 

Donuts were good. Standard yummy donuts. They have some interesting flavours like maple bacon and etc. I feel like their donuts are pretty dense and cakey which is a preference. I personally like airy, fluffy donuts but I'd still come back regardless.
author: Becca W.

description: Very nice staff, I believe Jenny is her name. The orange glaze donut is super bomb! Strawberry not so much...gotta catch em all!
author: Matt G.

description: They are super nice in here. Super addition to the neighborhood. Bacon donut have become the norm at donut shops nowadays but this place does it well at a good price. Let us try some free samples. Check their social media for flavors of the week. Not super fancy but a good standard shop and a good price.
author: Augusto M.

description:
Came here today because I was curious to see what this new place a few blocks down from my house was all about..

I was impressed. Excelling service , got a half dozen of donut holes, and 2 blueberry donuts for the price of only $3!! The blueberry donuts were a little on the more dry side but they were still tasty and satisfied my sweet tooth.  In addition, the nice lady gave me an extra donut on the house as well! I will def be back soon
author: Cassondra G.

description: I thought it was pretty average.  Not too sweet.  Not soggy.  I had the blueberry filled which was great.  Plenty of filling in it.  The maple bacon jalapeno was interesting, and despite the odd flavor combo, ok.  I might want to try the original version next time I visit.  Shared the dozen I bought with my roommates.  They also thought they were just normal donuts.  Which is fine, because donuts are normally good.
author: Audrey D.

description: I was expecting more options and left with blueberry and strawberry donuts. All in all a-ok.
author: Josie C.

description: Deeeeeeeeelicious......great quality, unique flavors and most importantly CLEAN. There arent many good donut shops left in San Francisco but if you want something consistent and good...come by here. My favorite has got to be the blueberry cake donut and the weekend specials. Dont forget to make the guiness bailey cream donut Paul.
author: Gary L.

description:
Yawn.

Typical donut fare, not worth a special trip. I'd say it's a step above a Safeway donut. 

The donuts were ok, but I certainly don't think it's worth the hype happening here on yelp. Reading reviews, you'd think this was the avenues answer to Dynamo.

I didn't see anything unique or special that could not be found at Uncle Benny's or any of the other donut shops nearby.
author: J. M.

description: Very clean establishment. VERY NUCE OWNER. donuts perfectly shaped, colorful but (yes there is a butt) dense. Almost cake like. A few bites I could taste the oil. Blueberry, strawberry were good. Buttermilk, chocolate, glaze, bar didn't stand out.
author: Cee B.

description: Nice place for a quick sugar fix and cup of Joe.  The guy behind the counter was really nice and accommodating. Asked if it was our first time there and gave us a blueberry doughnut hole just coming in. Next time we're in the Sunset district I'll be there!
author: joe m.

description:
The peanut butter and jelly donuts were excellent, and so were the famous maple-bacon donuts and the regular donuts with sprinkles. 

Everything looked great, and the service could not have been more friendly and quick.  They apparently run special varieties that are announced on their Facebook page. 

I predict this place is going to get crowded and popular quickly, so check it out before the mobs start arriving.
author: K C.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood! My housemate came back home with coffee and donuts. Instead of staring longingly at his breakfast, I walked over here and grabbed my own. The apple fritter was very apple-y. More so than my favorite apple fritter place. The donuts here are cheaper than the other places I've been to around here. The coffee is pretty strong which is a huge plus. I hereby give the donuts 3.5 stars, coffee 4 stars, and the service a freaking 5. When I go out for donuts I don't expect a smile or any glimpse of friendliness so this place really exceeded my expectations.
author: Irene C.

description: I celebrated my birthday by having some delicious donuts from here today.  Their specials were the baconpena and PB&J.  Both were awesome.  The baconpena was their maple donut with bacon and just a bit of jalapeno to make it spicy.  The PB&J was exactly that but not too over powering of a taste.  We also got some blueberry holes which were great too.
author: Blake B.

description: Very nice place to stop and have a snack and some coffee. Owners and employees are great. Only downside is that it's a bit pricey for donuts here.
author: Johnson Q.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood, Twisted!  We've been waiting for this shop to open.  There's really no place around to just sit and have an excellent cup of coffee and a treat, so we were thrilled to see the Open sign today.  Really nice people!  The owners are very friendly and helpful, with a family history of making good donuts for those of us who truly appreciate one... or two.  The coffee is exceptional, my husband and I both had the Columbian, our favorite, and it was as good as Columbian can get.  Rich and delicious.  We each had an old fashioned donut, fresh and deliciously chocolate glazed, and left with an apple fritter to try (husband's favorite).  I can't tell you how much I appreciated a donut without oil or grease.

The place is modern, fresh, and scrupulously clean.  A nice, inviting look.  I'm already thinking it will be the perfect place to sit, in front of that great large window, and watch the rain.  When the rain comes.  Hopefully, often this year :)
author: Elyn S.

description: Really excellent selection of quality donuts for cheap, fantastic coffee (not watered down or burnt), variety of ATMs close by and plenty of parking in the mornings.
author: Andrew F.

description: I've been here a few times since, mostly for the specials they do on the weekends. Super yummy and creative too! I love the berry crunch and the Milky Way one! Their cruellers and cream puffs though are worth noting for sure!
author: Christian R.

description: I came here to try the maple bacon donut at 10:00 on a weekday, but sadly they were out of their most popular item. I opted for the glazed twist which was good as well. The other items like the blueberry cake donut and the old-fashioned cake donuts look scrumptious, but one donut is filling enough. I also heard that they carry variations similar to the Voodoo donut shop in Oregon like an oreo donut and a cereal donut. Before checking out, the owner dropped in a few extra donut holes free of charge. Noriega is lucky to have this non pretentious donut shop serving up unique donuts. I will be back!
author: Jessica E.

description: stopped in at 5pm and they were out of my two fave donuts- French cruellers and blueberry donuts. Regular chocolate and blueberry cake donut didn't disappoint. Although the choc was a bit dry but typical of these types of donuts. The person working behind the donuts was super pleasant and smiley. Such a nice experience.
author: Aleks F.

description: I was craving a donut one morning and stopped by expecting just normal donuts. I ordered a chocolate sprinkled and an apple fritter. When I got to work there were three donut holes included! My first bite was of the chocolate sprinkled and OMG it was so fluffy and perfect and ???? wow I've had a lot of donuts but this donut was so fluffy! How! The apple fritter is also amaaazing as mentioned by other reviewers. Highly recommended little donut shop. Perfect location in Sunset and super sweet owner.
author: Traci L.

description:
I woke up this morning thinking of Twisted's blueberry donut.  It's excellent, and so is the apple fritter! They also serve peerless coffee, which is a rare find.  

Those behind the counter are super friendly and even threw in a couple donut holes.  The atmosphere isn't quite up to my level of comfort, but there were some folks who had laptops out and books open.  

Heading over now!
author: Stella K.

description:
The first time I went to twisted six months ago I was excited to see your new donut place in the city. I revisited this morning I was greeted by friendly smile and proceeded to order half dozen donuts to myself. I tried the furrito, too sweet for me. The rest of the donuts, maple bar, chocolate twist, cinnamon twist, and vanilla frosted classic, were amazing. She even threw in some extra doughnut holes. 

The outter sunset needed a place like this, and I will be back again, to possibly order a dozen, to myself.
author: Andy C.

description: I love the apple fritter, even though it's on the sweet side but it's so moist. It's big enough to be 2 donuts! Yummy with coffee. Sometimes they will run out of certain types of donuts depending on the time of the day. Service is also friendly!
author: Allyson L.

description:
Hesitant to write a review because I don't want the place to get crowded, but I know that businesses need to make money too and these yelp reviews help.

Super nice mom&pop shop with lots of classic donuts and special donuts every day.

Prices are reasonable. If you think it's expensive, then use the money you would have saved to go somewhere else. Seriously, how many donuts are you eating that the 25 cents more for a couple donuts would set you back.

This place is really for the locals living around the area and not a place to drive across the city for. Kinda like the Bashful Bull scene when it was around (if you don't know what Bashful Bull's is, you ain't a local to the area).
author: Timothy L.

description:
OMG YOU MUST VISIT AT LEAST ONCE IN YOUR LIFE:

The owners are amazing and sweet. The donuts are fresh and delicious. I love love love this place and every time I get the chance I pull over and grab some donuts for the way. I always get a Maple Bacon donut, which has a perfect balance of sweet and salty. Last time, the lady who got me the donuts told me her favorite was the blueberry cake one. I tried it, and it was amazing! The actual donut was soft and fresh. 

I love this place, fast service and pretty cheap prices. It's super kid-friendly and honestly I might just buy 12 dozen just to have them around :).
author: Yael L.

description:
Donuts werent that good. The cream of the filling is veary greasy and the dough is pretty average. 
Coffee: average as well. 
Service: very friendly

They serve iced coffee with coffee ice cubes which is a plus.
author: S L.

description: Great buttermilk bars! And the guy that works there is a homie.
author: Dede C.

description:
I was thrilled to see this new donut shop pop up and stopped one day on my way back from the beach.  Everyone who works there is friendly and the selection of different kind of donuts is unreal.  

I chose two - maple covered long john and cinnamon twist - and while the long john was quite delicious, the cinnamon twist was a disappointment.  Granted, I've grown up eating cinnamon twist and am quite snobbish about them, I found this one to be underwhelming.

If you're in the area, it is definitely worth a stop, especially to try all of the fun, unique options.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Finally, a little place nearby the 10 min. oil change spot to grab a quick decadent snack & a cup of coffee while you wait.

Blueberry donut with peanuts on top was fun, and since it was opening day, they threw in a couple of donut holes.  Good people too.  Good luck!
author: Kevin D.

description: Great selection of donuts, always fresh. Ham cheese and jalapeño croissant is very good also. I wish they had bagels! Pretty easy to park in the morning. Employees are very nice and throw in a extra donut almost every time.
author: Rebecca M.

description: friendly service and cant complain bout the donut was goood but got a normal one and it was a lil pricy
author: Phuc B.

description:
Absolutely delightful. This is a wonderful edition to Noriega Street. I love coming here in the mornings. They have an assortment of coffees, donuts, croissants, pastries, teas, and other drinks. Everything is made and baked freshly and the service is super friendly. I love their coffee, and the highlight for me was the ham and cheese croissants which are melt in your mouth goodness and have me completely hooked! I come here in the mornings on the weekends! There is seating inside. The donuts also are extremely popular but Im not as much of a fan of sweets as I am of savoury and salty. This cafe has loads to offer and is a little gem in what is sometimes a foggy neighbourhood morning where you just have to have a nice big Coffee with a pastry or somethink else when feeling a bit peckish! Love this place! 

It is however, not good for groups or ill behaved noisy children.
author: Julian I.

description: The donuts were okay. I think they were hyped up and they are pretty expensive! We got one each of the regular chocolate, glazed (definitely not enough glaze on it), maple bacon, and chocolate chip granola and paid $9. I would prefer to go to a mom & pop shop. It would have been better and cheaper.
author: Thea M.

description: I hope in the future I will see some low sugar varieties to choose from.  Right now there is one no sugar, but I was hoping for low sugar.
author: Tony W.

description: I miss the old days in SF when donut shops like this used to dot the city like artisan coffee houses now do. This place is all about really good, classic donuts - love the blueberry cake donut, buttermilk bar, and the old-fashioned. The maple bacon could be better... definitely go with the classics!
author: Louise C.

description:
Stepped in during a trip to Noreiga St. Seeing as this was a new donut shop and I can't resist the siren call of donuts, I decided to order a dozen of their donut holes. The menu seemed really simple and the workers were nice and attentive. I asked about their opening and found out they were opened just recently and they had a Facebook page to keep everyone informed of their new creations.

Their donut holes were really light and not doughy at all. I prefer a chew to my donut holes, but I can respect the lightness in these. 

The interior looked like someone's downstairs man cave which I like. The floor is a bit lower and the veiling is really low from what I can remember.

Looking forward to my next trip!
author: George Z.

description: Delicious donuts at such an affordable price! I purchased 12 dozen mini donut holes + 1/2 dozen regular donuts (a combo of filled, glazed, bacon) for $14! The lady was also so nice and sweet, which added extra bonus points! I'll be coming back!
author: Kristen T.

description:
Love, Love Love this place!  I am so happy to have another choice to stop by for breakfast and/or pick up a quick lunch for the kids on our way to school.
We've had so far the croissants fresh out of the oven, my oldest has had their hamd and cheese croissant, and finally both my husband and I have brought in the maple bacon donuts to the office.  YUMMY
I just wish their coffee was a little bit stronger.............if I could combine the noriega coffee house coffee with twisted donuts, I would be in heaven.
author: Rio K.

description: Great customer service! I only had the mocha and it is super yummy. Keeping me toasty on this cold rainy day. Donuts look yummy! May have to try it next time I'm in the neighborhood. I would rather spend money on a place that appreciate all their customers.
author: Fadzlyana I.

description: Came across this place a year ago through yelp and have been hooked ever since. Delicious donuts and great service. Blueberry donuts are a must-try!
author: Nanet L.

description: THE BEST DONUT SHOP EVER. We drive out of our way for their donuts and grey service. Jenny (the shop owner) is outstanding, consistently remembers to give us deals and is always cheerful. Highly recommend this shop!
author: Stacey C.

description: Creative donuts, lovely customer service (I do mean lovely) the woman is amazing. Honestly I come early in the morning and grab a donut and maybe some coffee, spend 5 dollars (yeah 5 dollars) tip her nicely every time and come out with a smile. Fucking go here people. I highly recommend trying this place, you won't regret it!
author: Mitch J.

description:
Favorite new donut shop, so happy they opened up! Use to go to donut time but they always ran out and wasnt that much of a selection. My husband and I just moved back to SF and I was surprised to find the glazed blueberry donut! I have only had it before from concord from kings donut when my dad woukd bring them home.

Customer service is great! They are super friendly and patient while making your selection/s. The owner ia super sweet and always with a smile on her face and very welcoming as well as the staff.

The donuts are delicious especially the maple bacon its the perfect mix of sweet and savory =) they are light and fluffy.

This ia def our go to donut shop when we are craving something sweet.
author: HunNee S.

description:
I walked in after work (around 5:45) and was greeted by the nicest lady (possibly the owner).  She had quite a selection of donuts to choose from.  There  were cake donuts, raised donuts, twists, bars, filled donuts, apple fritters and donut holes to pick from. Some flavors were blueberry, orange, lemon, maple bacon, traditional chocolate, sugar, and glazed.  I got the blueberry cake and chocolate raised donut to take home.  The nice lady also threw in a free orange cake donut to sample as well.  I also got an iced coffee.  She uses coffee ice cubes for the coffee so it's not a watered down mess.  The coffee was great.  I tasted the blueberry donut and even though it was already late in the day, they tasted like she just made them fresh.  

This place has it all together. Nice, friendly lady, great donuts and non-watered down iced coffee.  5 stars!!
author: Maria G.

description:
Been waiting for a coffee/donut shop to pop up in the area and it's finally here!

The donuts are awesome
Jenny is awesome

Just wish they had more coffee options!
author: Jimmy W.

description: An awesome, organized, & clean donut shop. Greeted by a friendly gentlemen the moment my family and I walked in on a Thursday afternoon to grab a few tasty treats. We tried the maple bacon, raised glazed, (both which had good texture & flavor at first bite) & apple fritter (sweet enough to satisfy your sweet tooth). They were all yummy and satisfied our donut cravings that day. We're glad we decided to give this place a try. Overall, great first time experience and great customer service. We will be back to try other favors for sure. :)
author: Honor J.

description:
.14.12.15     First Visit

Above average place
Have the core basics and some 
  donuts with a twist on them

Weekend ... 
   is where they do more twisted donuts.

The worker was super friendly and 
   brimming with enthusiam..
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I tried the plain sugar glazed donut and a chocolate donut. I think the chocolate one tasted better because  it had more flavor and less soggy on the bottom. The glazed donut was a bit wet on the bottom and not much taste. Their texture is good which was light and airy. I am not sure the wetness was due to me stopping by towards 2pm.

Recommend to try: Chocolate topped donut

I may try it again one day in the morning. This time maybe a specialty donut.
author: Irene L.

description: cheap and delicious! I come here every week. this morning I wanted to try a savory croissant, but there were no vegetarian ones. when the cashier found out, she made me one lightning fast with egg and cheese, even though there was a long line. she is always so accommodating and sweet - and the sandwich was amazing!!
author: Allison P.

description:
Best maple bacon donut I've ever had. 

Basic coffee choice is right up my alley, however, if it's not for you, friendly service and donuts make up for the lack of espresso drinks.
author: Wyatt R.

description:
I don't crave donuts too often, but when I do - the craving is STRONG, which sucks because there aren't any legit donut spots near me (Parkmerced). Since I consider anything outside of my living room far, Twisted is a teeny bit out of the way but well worth the drive. The staff is friendly, and when I ordered a gang of doughnuts for the office they were accommodating. 

Like with most bakeries, it's best to get there in the morning when everything is fresh. My favorites are the bacon, jalepeno, maple doughnut, the PB&J doughnut (what?!), and most of all the blueberry doughnut. I rarely ever eat two doughnuts at a time, but they did it for me.
author: Abby B.

description: Traditional donuts done well with some less typical flavors. the orange glaze was surprisingly good and the service was perfect.
author: Daniel E.

description:
Donuts taste very fresh and there is none of that grease/oil taste that often accompanies other donuts, so 5 stars for quality.

However, the raised donuts are too dense for our taste, none of that fluffiness that raised donuts are known for.
