Their chocolate glaze is a little on the sweet side for our taste (think similar to Krispy Kreme's sugar content).

Coffee is very good.

Staff is friendly.

However, they overcharged us by a buck or two last time we were there.  I didn't realize till we got home.  Called to verify charges and the young lady I spoke to was super apologetic.
author: Thespa D.

description: I've only been here once but I fell in love with it! I was craving a donut so my boyfriend found this place and we got a couple extra for my coworkers. The donuts tastes really fresh and the lady working there was super sweet!
author: Priscilla S.

description: Dare I say it? As good as Bob's, but with a more focused menu. This place is dangerous.
author: Martin M.

description: I come to Twisted Donuts a few times a month... because they are the only donut shop in the entire sunset! The lady that runs the shop couldn't be sweeter, and she's one of the reasons I keep coming back. But the donuts just aren't that good. They look appealing, but seem to be too dry and have a faint chemical taste to them. The long johns here are significantly small in size and lacking in chocolate or maple frosting quantity and taste. The apple fritters are too spongy and soft and missing tangible chunks of apple. The maple bacon donut is mediocre at best, and their prices are on the higher side. Their coffee is decent for your standard donut shop, which I usually find to have terrible coffee. Bottom line, if you need your fix but don't want to drive too far for a cheap treat, try twisted donuts.
author: Dylan B.

description: I think this is the only donut shop with a Boston(Bavarian) creme donut. I've searched for so long for one in this city, and I've finally found it! It's pretty tasty to boot too!
author: Alan S.

description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood. The special donuts were all sold out as we went late in the day. But there were plenty to choose from and they were all delicious . We will be going back tomorrow morning
author: Melanie H.

description:
Donuts were just okay but service was good and they were really helpful. 

We had the: blueberry donut, maple bacon, orange glazed, and the donut holes. 
Everyone raves about the blueberry donut and even for someone that has a huge sweet tooth, it was way too sweet for my liking. The maple bacon donut was also kind of dry... Maybe I got an old one but it wasn't that great either LOL. Orange glazed tasted like orange rinds, which im not a fan of. The plain glazed donut holes were good!! The texture was chewy and bouncy which I enjoyed. Other than that, its just whatever.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This is a new Donut shop along Noriega that opened very recently.  It has a nice selection of donuts and seems pretty fresh.  I tried the maple bacon and it was solid.
They also threw in a complementary "sample" chocolate donut.  Will be back
author: Brian C.

description: A generous coworker brought these in and I couldn't help but indulge! I sampled the maple bacon, strawberry and blueberry. The maple bacon was by far my favorite. Sometimes sweets with bacon can take on a greasy or overly fatty tasting quality or be overpowered with the bacon -  not so with Twisted donuts! The bacon was not overly greasy, salty or smokey and paired wonderfully with the maple glaze and donut that was slightly crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Highly recommended!
author: Juliana C.

description: Stopped by Twisted Donuts to try some of their goods.  The people that greeted us were very friendly and helped us pick what we should get.  They were having a special buy 3 get 1 free.  We decided to get the pink french donut, the maple bacon, the apple fritter, and the blueberry donut. Each and every donut was overly sweet to me.  I also like my donuts light and fluffy and the donuts I tried were all more on the heavy side.  The best one out of the 4 was surprisingly the maple bacon donut which basically tasted like you were eating a full on pancake and bacon breakfast.  Although they were very friendly and patient while I selected which donuts to purchase, the actual donut was too sweet for my taste.
author: Christine D.

description: I love this place, and, when I lived relatively close by, would sometimes go in to eat one (just one! It's possible) donut, sip on some iced coffee, and use their wifi. This is a relatively new store, totally spotless, super down-to-earth, and with high quality products, a few of which are more experimental. Wish I could buy and eat a gazillion donuts at a time to support the (true!) adorable owners, but I would probably die immediately from sugar overload. :P
author: Shendi X.

description: Had the Bacon Peño donut (it had chopped jalapeño on it). It was okay.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
This place just opened so their selection is a bit limited. However, as they grow I'm sure they will be able to expand and make a wider variety of stuff. 

I find both their cake and classic style donuts to be just right in consistency.Nothing too fancy, just good, fresh donuts. They can even fill your donut with custard (and probably more) on demand!

The lady who runs the place is very friendly, keeps it very clean and likes to throw in the occasional free treat as well! I think a 5 star rating in the "classic donut" category is easily deserved.
author: Nick W.

description: I loved this donut shop. The donuts were delectable. And their iced coffee is really neat because they use frozen coffee cubes. So when you accidentally leave it in your cupholder in the car overnight and then need to hop in the car first thing in the morning to take the kids to school, you have ready-to-go coffee in your old cup that doesn't taste the worst.
author: Sara C.

description: This has become my favorite doughnut place after I walked past it one day. Its one of the places that I know of that have maple bacon doughnut. The texture of the doughnut when you bite into it is what keeps me coming back here. The doughnut is really soft and fluffy  and tastes perfect. The owner is super friendly and she gives out doughnut holes every once in a while.
author: Allen Y.

description: Yum! Donuts are tasty and fresh.  Service is always friendly. Best place for donuts in the Sunset!
author: C O.

description: My wife and I aren't normally donut fans, but we in San Fran for a long weekend and found Twisted Donuts. We love it!  The food is wonderful. The selection is outstanding. And, the staff is incredibly friendly. I can't think of a better way to start our day. Be sure and come on the weekend for the "special" donuts... maple/bacon/jalapeño, fruirritos... etc
author: Jim S.

description: The maple bacon donut is SO DELICIOUS and that's an understatement. I took one bite and I devoured the whole thing. I didn't even want to share it with my boyfriend! The maple bacon with jalepeno wasn't that great, the jalepeno killed it for me. But the maple bacon one is on point! This is the first time I've tried a donut with bacon on it and I'll just say it won't be my last. The lady behind the counter was so friendly. She asked my boyfriend and I how we were both doing and was so patient with us since it was our first time. She gave us a sample and even added a few donut holes for us. I've read that they serve iced coffee with coffee ice cubes. I MUST try it next time with a dozen maple bacon donuts. I'm so sad that I only got one of them but next time, I'll be sure to get hella. I can't wait to come back :)
author: Brenda K.

description: We stopped in for doughnuts around 4:00 in the afternoon on a Tuesday after a trip to the zoo. We got a raised glazed doughnut, a raised chocolate frosted doughnut, a blueberry cake doughnut, and a chocolate frosted buttermilk bar. Service was excellent, the store was clean, and the doughnuts were affordable ($5.15 for 4). The doughnuts were so good, some of the best I've ever had. This is especially notable, given that it was so late in the afternoon and most doughnut places serve stale doughnuts by this time.
author: Terri D.

description: I was very intrigued when I saw their menu. Maple bacon donuts on Noriega!!! Well for 2:75 I expected a fantastic donut but what I got was a basic maple glazed donut with not crunchy enough bacon. The staff was very nice
author: Mark N.

description: Donuts are good. The specialty donuts get sold out fast so you have to come early. I LOVE the way they make their ice coffee with coffee ice. Sooooo good! Just wished they had simple syrup instead of sugar packets to really bring it home for me.
author: Wendy L.

description: Love the cream puffs and the donuts are yummy. Great small neighborhood donut shop. Owner is sweet as she offers samples to try different donuts. I love coming here. If it was t for my diet I would there more often.
author: Minna M.

description: Awesome little place just off the road. Maple bacon and Boston cream donughts were very good. Coffee was great and the staff was very helpful.
author: Matthew S.

description: Was really cravings some donuts these couple of days and I found this place on yelp. I like how its pretty close to my house in the sunset. I didn't like how there are no signs for the doughnuts and no prices. I just got a custard, rasberry and some maple bacon doughnuts to try. The rasberry was ok but the filling is a little too sour. The custard is really sweet but not custardy enough. The maple bacon is good though. I like how they have a Monday buy 3 get one free special.
author: Carmen L.

description: This is our favorite donut place and would normally (5*), until today...  We went to Twisted Donuts this morning and my son wanted an apple fritter.  There was one up against the window display.  With the case lighting it looked alittle dark, but pretty good.  The lady bagged up our order and we went home.   The circumference of the fritter was black and a good 1/2 inch round was completely unedible. I took it back and they replaced it.  The woman came to the counter and apologized.  As I took the other bag, she asked me if I still really wanted the apple fritter, because she says it the same as the burnt one (just not AS bad).  WOW!!!  She knew they were both burnt and sold us the REALLY burnt one, hoping that we won't make the trip back...  I picked another donut and she gave me back the price difference.  Really?!?!?  For the trip back and forth and paying the meter twice,  I got 50 cents back!!  This is our favorite donut place and I'm upset that they would pull a bait and switch and even worse, knowingly sell unedible product!!  So, be warned...if you buy donuts from Twisted, check before you leave.  It may save you the headache!
author: Reg W.

description: I don't care for donuts but after meeting the lady I wanted to at least purchase one to support her. One is never one with me. I tend to get carried away when purchasing things. Originally I was gonna get the maple bacon glazed donut which lead to the bear claw, blueberry, glazed blueberry, old fashioned (if I were to enjoy a donut this is my choice), some sort of buttermilk glazed donut not shaped as a donut (not sure what it's called), then ended up ordering the apple fritter? Cause she gave me a sample.. Then she threw in some donut holes on the house & told me about the REAL orange glazed donut & threw that in for free too! $7.75 for 6 that I chose. Right before pulling out of my parking space she knocks on my window telling me she thinks she forgot the maple BACON donut & I try to pay her but she says no!! It's my fault! I insist she takes the money but she says no again & runs off. Such a sweet lady!!!!!! She must've had plenty of these delicious donuts in her lifetime. Totally love her personality & smile. I wish her & her business the best of luck! I definitely will be back to purchase for friends since I don't eat them. Also they were out of the BACON-PEÑO donut which sounds orgasmic!
author: melanie t.

description: Cool new place that opened up in my neighborhood. The named twisted gets me all confused because their donut flavones aren't very unique. They have most of the classic flavors you find in any donut shop. The good one however is their maple bacon donut. I just wished their donuts were alittle more fluffy. They're a bit dense. I don't know of I would go back because for one they're kind of expensive. I still like dynamo donuts better. Even voodoo donuts are worth the wait if you're in Portland.
author: Gina S.

description: The donuts had good textures, but nothing unique about the flavors. Very sugary glazes and frostings.
author: Ellie M.

description: Jenny is so nice and friendly, the donuts taste fluffy and fresh even though I came at 5:30pm, amazing! Love this place and they even have Colombian coffee! Oh yeah!
author: Stacy Y.

description: Extremely nice owner and delicious blueberry donuts! The cream puffs on the weekend are also so tasty. Try everything!
author: Jackie S.

description: Family owned, great service and tasty donuts! We had the blueberry with lemon icing (with a fress lemon wedge!), the mango donut, old fashion with chocolate glaze, and an old fashion with what I thought was a orange color icing but that ended up tasting like an orange julius with real orange flavor! Happy to have them in the neighborhood!
author: Mamie C.

description: My wish became true! i always wished that there would be  a good donut shop by my house and there it was! literraly up the block from my house! I am a nut when it comes to donuts! I LOVE DONUTS! when this place first opened for buisness I went and let me tell you! this place has the freshest the yummiest donuts ever! my favorite are the original donut dots,cream filled donut dots and i love the custard filled donuts! I  go there all the time and buy a bunch always and will continue to! they also do catering/big orders! try this place you wont regret it!
author: Bariska Y.

description: Yummy Yummy I ain't no Dummy!!! This place is a super sweet little donut shop ;) the maple bacon donut was AMAZING! As well as the apple fritter. Grandma and I shared sooo not to over stuff. Which would probably be easy if you're a donut freak like me. Very friendly staff and I even got a free sample to give my hubby ! Uh oh! My keyboard is sticky from maple frosting........
author: Rita B.

description: I'm a little bit of a health nerd, so I've never really been that into doughnuts.  This place opened a few blocks from my home several months ago, and recently I had a sugar craving, so I finally tried it.  I've been back like 4 times in the past 3 days and I find myself day dreaming about the next doughnut I will try.  The cream filled doughnut holes are addictive.  Everything else here is pretty phenomenal, too.  Delicious and pretty icing, perfect texture, and a plethora of flavors and fillings make coming here so much fun.
author: Selene W.

description: Can't wait for this donut shop to open. Just talked to the owners seem like very nice laid back people , and they just allowed me to sample their  blueberry muffins yummy!!! Can't wait for the rest of the donuts !!!
author: Ken B.

description: Maple bacon donuts did not disappoint. Lots of big bacon pieces, and the maple was not too sweet, not to mention the soft and moist texture of the bread. Very delicious! They were making fresh cream puffs in the back so they gave me one to try - super fresh cream with very light pastry surrounding it was pretty special. Lastly, i was in a croissant kind of mood, so i ordered one, and the lady there said that she didnt want to sell me a day old one, to which i said i was fine with it, but she gave me two free glazed donuts along with it!  Yummy donuts and sweet people, and i loved their clean seating area, which is hard to find in a donut shop.  I would go back!
author: minnie l.

description: Friendly owners and clean location. My boyfriend and I stopped by hoping to satisfy our cravings. We ordered some donut holes, old fashion, and chocolate covered donut. However, we were both disappointed. The donut holes were a bit dry and so was the chocolate covered donut... Very much overrated. I'm sticking with Uncle Benny's Donuts for donut holes.
author: Mazie H.

description:
Damn your great customer service! I come in maybe once or twice a month for a breakfast croissant (which are super yummy) and the owner knows I secretly love crullers. Knowing what I like when I'm not in there every week and still remembering me makes me loves this place even more. 

Plus they have everything from traditional to 'special' of the day. Try the maple-bacon, it's sweet and salty and soft and crunchy. So yummy!
author: Adrienne C.

description: Delicious donuts and very lovely staff! They're very kind! I just wish my pb&j donut wasn't so sweet due to the great amount of jam inside but nevertheless amazing place! Five stars!
author: Karen J.

description:
I was browsing yelp for a donut place on Noriega closer to central sunset, and stumbled across this little gem! As of today, they just opened up two weeks and a day ago. My eyes lit up with excitement as I clicked on the pics of this new donut shop.  

I am a big fan of blueberry cake donuts ( oh how I miss the days of rolling pin donuts!) and Twisted Donuts & Coffee makes them!  I wasn't sure what time they open ( FYI -- they open at 6am, close at 7pm), hoping they would be open in the morning so I could stop by on my way to work., and sure enough they are! 

Pulled up in front of the shop at 8am. Walked in... And was promptly greeted by the very friendly owner.  She was telling me that I just missed out as she just ran out of the maple bacon donuts.  I told her that was okay because I was there for the blueberry cake donuts which I love. I bought a half dozen for me and some of my co-workers, and the owner was so sweet...she gave me a blueberry filled donut on the house ( smart and kind business practice!:)

I am thrilled that there's a new donut shop in the neighborhood. It might be a bad thing though if I frequent Twisted too often! ;)

Everybody has different donut standards. But for me, these donuts were fresh, tasted good, and the owner/ service was friendly.  All great things in my book! I'll probably stop again this week ( chances are good that I'll probably stop by again tomorrow!:)
author: Jenn T.

description: So disappointed!  We are from out of town and we were excited after reading all the awesome reviews and they are out of donuts for the day !!! I only give them one star because the girl working was nice.
author: Melinda D.

description: Coffee in one hand donut in another...im a happy man.  Their bacon donuts are kickass!! Better than dynamo's bacon donuts hands down.  Sometimes they run out of of the bacon donuts so make sure you get here early.  Oh thanks for the extra donut holes and extra calories.
author: Marcus D.

description: If you prefer your donuts on the cakey side, its great. But I was not a fan...
author: Warren S.

description: Love this place! Their coffee is amazing iced and hot. Jenny is AWESOME come here if you want delicious donuts and good service!
author: Fernanda C.

description: Amazing Donuts! Fresh coffee, unique and fun donuts to choose from makes this my new go-to donut shop! I recommend trying their Maple frosting and bacon donut, hits the spot! Staff was nice and friendly. There's also plenty of street parking for convenience.
author: James F.

description: Maybe we hit an off day? Maybe we just don't like Twisted's style of doughnut. However, all in my party thought our doughnuts were decidedly mediocre. The flavors were reasonably good, but we all thought the underlying doughnuts were underdone. We rushed out when we saw all the rave yelp reviews. My family LOVES good doughnuts. Sadly, our opinion is this place is not the next Voodoo Doughnuts. :(
author: Michael S.

description: This is the perfect mix of a classic and inventive donut shop. To boot, it has some dirt cheap prices for SF. Definitely worth a journey to the Sunset.
author: Jeremy G.

description: We love donuts and were so glad that we finally have a one close by.  Twisted Donuts is a delightful place  with cheerful owners (Joyce and Jenny).  They make their sweets on-site, and it taste like it.  Place is very very clean (a very good thing), and the place is welcoming.  I hope they put up more chairs, tables and maybe a couch, offer free wi-fi, play soft music, and I bet they'll garner more patrons.  GOOD LUCK!
author: Joel M.

description: Twisted heavens! I only eat donuts once in a while because I'm not too big of a donut fan since they're usually too sweet.  But I could eat several Twisted donuts at once...they're that good.  And that blueberry donut is a real winner.  I initially wasn't going to get the bb donut because my friend said, "ew blueberries," but then the owner baited me with bb donut samples and I became all oh-god-I-need-to-get-one.  She's so wicked!
author: Renee L.

description:
The owner lady working by herself was all smiles when I came in today. There were definitely more maple bacon donuts and apple fritters available today! :) Not only that, they had a new jalapeno bacon maple (?) donut too.
Cake donuts are still on point, especially the blueberry. Got some holes too.
She also threw in an extra donut for free. How can I not give 5 stars?!
ALWAYS positive vibes from the workers here
author: Bianca Y.

description: The twisted donut was mediocre. It wasn't particularly bad but they could have done better.
author: Rea M.

description: I tried a medley of donuts and couldn't decide on a favorite. They didn't have raspberry filled donuts (my go-to donut), but the lady that was working there offered to make one for me on the spot. Customer service is on point, and it's tough to dislike this sweet, fried, deliciousness.
author: Cindy D.

description: Nutella frutetta was good... Nutella in a crunchy fried shell.  Otherwise just an average donut shop.
author: Sarah S.

description: Everytime I come here there is always the best service. The lady here is so sweet, occasionally she'll sneak in several donut holes for ya. This place has really delicious donuts too! I'm always going to come back here!!
author: Tracy V.

description: Place is nice. Only serves coffee and tea tho. We would like to see expresso or other types of heavy caffeinated drinks. This place just opened but I don't go there too often
author: Rob T.

description: Just came in and service was great!!! Blueberry donut holes were amazing!!!! Best I have ever had :)
author: Sue T.

description: I went on a day where the donuts were a tad on the stale side but they were still SO GOOD. I liked the cream puffs a lot - those were fresh. Also, the lady who was working there was so sweet.
author: Emma M.

description: Such a cute little donut shop in the neighborhood! It's very clean and the atmosphere is very friendly (thanks god it's not a 24/7 kind of establishment as on 9th @ Judah). Great spot to satisfy sugar cravings!)
author: Katie K.

description: Cool spot. Good coffee. Donuts were great honestly. Not happy that there is a minimum purchase requirement for debit/credit cards, but that seems to be the norm at most places nowadays.
author: Kaelin B.

description:
Ordered the pumpkin fritter (perfect, not too sweet), bacon maple jalapeño (terrible, too savory), blueberry donut holes (yum!!), espresso (meh), and orange cake (refreshing and surprisingly good)

Really appreciate that they gave us a free donut (the Orange cake)

We'll be back, we just won't order the bacon maple jalapeño
author: Ben S.

description: My husband came here to try it out while I was off working in sesttle for the summer . He wanted to get 2 dozen donuts for work but they couldn't take cards yet and he only had $20 cash (because they hadn't yet set up their credit card processor). The woman that helped him was able to give him and even 20 for $20! His coworkers liked them, no complaints there. Hope they stick around for more than a few months. The neighborhood has been through a few businesses these past 3 years.
author: Crys L.

description:
I'm really happy to see this type of establishment pop up deep in the Sunset.  It is very clean, the workers/owners are nice and the donuts venture past the traditional.  The only problem is the actual donuts aren't very good.  They aren't bad, they're just "meh"  We had a blueberry, old fashioned glazed, and a chocolate raised.  The blueberry was too sweet, the old fashioned had a bad interior texture, and the raised was off in taste.  I had a ham and cheese croissant that was good though.  

I'll go back to see if the donuts are better.  For now, I'll stick to Uncle Benny's since the donuts taste good even if they aren't as fancy.
author: Joe M.

description:
I'm not a big donut person. If I go to a donut place I usually grab an apple fritter or a plain one, but I just had to try a maple-bacon donut because, although I don't have much of a sweet tooth, I DO have a bacon tooth. I walked in and there was one person in front of me and I thought "fantastic" until it quickly became apparent that the one person was one of "those" people. You know the type, someone who has no concept of the fact other people are waiting behind them (don't care) and take an excruciatingly long time to decide what they want while asking every conceivable question. Well, I was in no real hurry so I stuck it out. The woman behind me didn't feel the same way and after waiting quite awhile, left. As we were waiting a, (what's the appropriate title?), refuse collection engineer, ran in, and shouted "best donuts in SF!" while continuing on to the bathroom. Ok, sounds good.

Once I finally got to order, I went for a bacon-maple, an apple fritter, a cinnamon sugar and a coffee. (total time 60 seconds or less) Grabbed them and went off to jumped into my car, which, I discovered, was blocked by the refuse truck which had double-parked right next to my car. (even though there were plenty of empty spaces on either side). So, again, I wasn't in a hurry and after trying to back out with no luck, (another interesting tidbit, a SF cop drove by while I was trying to get out and showed no interest. City govt workers gotta stick together right?) I grabbed a donut out of my bag, turned on the radio and started munching and sipping my coffee. While doing this I looked up and a smile crossed my face. The person who had taken forever to order was parked right in front of me, and her painful look beamed  back to me from her rear view mirror. Ahh, there is justice in the universe.  Eventually the car in front of her left and we were freed from our imprisonment. The refuse guy never did reappear from the bathroom and it had been quite awhile by now. I wonder what happened to him.

BTW, the maple-bacon was good, but I'd prefer less maple and more bacon. The fritter was very good, but not special from others I've tried, and the cinnamon was good and fresh as well. 4 stars for the fresh donuts. I don't know how you speed up people without offending them (not my problem) but you lost a customer.
author: Rich M.

description: Every time I think of their maple bacon donut I get hungry . I literally just ate before writing this review and I'm starting to get hungry .So in summary , maple ...bacon...donut .
author: Toan T.

description: I love this place! Great coffee, great donuts, and the staff is very pleasant! I love their special donuts. I follow their Instagram so I can see which ones they have fresh from the oven :-)
author: Daniel M.

description: Oh my. I have a dangerous thing for donuts. And this has not abated in my 2nd trimester, let me tell you. I walked 31 blocks uphill to get here from my home in the outer outer sunset to earn my donut and it was totally worth it. They tasted fresh and amazing! I didn't try any of the specialty ones yet - I tend to go for something simple when discovering a new place, so I got an orange frosted cake donut with sprinkles...I feel like places don't have these often enough. No matter how many cinnamon bacon maple cronuts with butter almond ginger glaze saturate this city, you can't neglect the basics. Anyway, it was heavenly, and I'm totally coming back. It was also quiet and comfy to sit in and read a while, and the lady running the place was so sweet!
author: Carly G.

description: The maple bacon jalapeño donut was literally the best donut I've ever had. Try it with a small coffee. The lady that works there is very smiley and friendly. Lots of diversity among the employees which makes me smiley too :)
author: Rose M.

description: Love this neighborhood donut shop! Very good iced-coffee as well. The lady that works here is so sweet; when they didn't have the pb&j donut available when I came in, she personally made me a mini one to try for free, which was very good! Maple bacon is obviously one of the best, but so is the blueberry. Come early in the day when the donuts seem to be the freshest. Cheap, too!
author: Nicole K.

description: I only liked the original glazed, but that's because I prefer light and fluffy donuts.  Didn't care much for any of the other ones because they were more cakey and thick. I do want to come back and try the croissants tho.  Hopefully they won't be sold out the next time I go back.
author: Tina L.

description: Very tasty donuts!!  I tried the spicy maple bacon and PB&J.  Delish!
author: John M.

description: Came here afta' reading rewiews---OMG!!what a nest egg in neighborhood setting. Visiting from Southern California-wanted a Donut Saturday- came here...Nothing like this in Coachella Valley.. Nice friendly staff GREAT donuts. Will be back.
author: Bill F.

description: I was very excited to finally find a place with blueberry donuts and although they were very yummy, they still don't compare to the ones in my hometown.
author: Francisca C.

description: I was excited to try this place out and bought 1/2 a dozen of a variety of donuts. Not exactly what I expected. Donuts were dry, not moist at all. The first bite usually shows moist in the donut and sticks. This did not. 2 stars for effort and creativity with flavors.
author: Dianamarie C.

description: This little mom and pop shop has just become my new go to spot for donuts! The owner is very sweet and her donuts are delicious! It was my first time here so I asked for some recommendations. She generously offered me some free samples to try and I instantly fell in love with the blueberry donut. I also purchased the maple bacon donut (a local favorite) and I was pleasantly surprised by it's flavor! Needless to say, I will definitely be coming back soon for more!
author: Melissa T.

description: The maple bacon donut is the bomb!! So good! Beware because it will make you full for several hours! $2.75 each is a little pricy but I will buy again. I love the cream puffs too!! They put ice made of coffee in their iced coffee so the coffee tastes the same from the first to the last sip!
author: Jessie K.

description: One of the top donut shops in SF. They have a delicious selection of classic donuts and the owner is so sweet!
author: Anna G.

description: I came in to kill my maple bar craving and got the maple bar with a whipped cream center. The owner is super sweet and always had a smile on her face. After I left I looked into my bag and saw that she even included a free sprinkle donut!! Definitely will be coming back for more and to study since there's free wifi
author: Jane Z.

description: Love this place. The staff is friendly, the donuts delicious, and there's always hot, fresh peets coffee. My favorite is their blueberry cake donut, which has blueberries in the dough -- I was expecting just a glaze. The bathroom is very clean. There are always groups of people coming in to pick up donuts, but very few people actually sit and eat so there is room to work or read.
author: Natalie T.

description: Friendly service just as everyone said. Dropped by because I saw they they were finally open. Was delighted to see the donuts were super fluffy yet tasted very decadent. I've eaten at least 4 donut holes in the period of writing this review. Will definitely make this my new "bring donuts to work" spot. :)
author: Darline D.

description: I'm not a big fan of sweets, but my friends in SF told me I must try Twisted Donuts when I visit.  They were right.  Twisted Donuts did not disappoint!!  As many Yelpers have said before, the Baconpeno was a perfect mix of spicy and sweet.  The Nutella Fruirrito was awesome.  Really everything with Nutella is great.  TIP: Best to get there early for the specialty donuts as they are only available on weekends and they sell out fast!  I also had their cream puffs which were scrumptious.  They had just the right amount of cream and sweetness.  Will definitely stop by the next time I visit SF.
author: Alice Y.

description:
First time at Twisted today and I must say the experience was wonderful.  Terrific and super friendly service.  I had some questions about some of the offerings in the case and was offered a free sample.  

It does get better!  Everything I bought was yummy.  Gotta try the blueberry filled and the maple bacon.  The whip cream filled doughnut holes were fantastic, light/fluffy and not overly sweet.  

When I left and opened up my purchases I then realized they threw in free glazed doughnut holes in every bag.  Wow!

Summing things up:  If you want a great quality fresh doughnut this is the place.  Everything about this place is tops.
author: Wing C.

description: I heard Twisted opened up and went in today for a donut and coffee and ended up coming home with a lot more than I planned.  This is a truly legit donut shop!  The people working are super nice and they had a variety of donut samples laid out to try (apparently for people like me that can't make up their mind on what they want). I must have tried EVERY sample on that plate and since they all tasted great, I ended up in the same predicament of not knowing what I wanted.  I guess it's smart of them to offer those samples because in the end I bought a huge box of donuts to enjoy with the family at home.  I also sat inside with my box and enjoyed a coffee (which tasted fresh and strong) and ate an apple fritter (highly recommended). It's a pretty relaxing cozy atmosphere (they have a TV inside and you can people watch through the window on Noriega).  Overall a pleasant experience and I will be back (of course after I recover from my sugar high/coma).
author: H K.

description:
This place is so great, and has the nicest owners!  They didn't have the the cream filling in the kind of donut I wanted, and the lady behind the counter told me wait a minute, disappeared  for a second and came back with a machine full of fresh cream filling, and piped it into a donut just for me!

Really great donuts, really friendly people. The only downside for me was they have no Iced coffee!  I would be there basically every weekday morning if they did!
author: Eva L.

description: My 4 year old just sat in the store to eat one of the dozen we bought to go and said "best donuts ever!" so I had to review.
author: Becky M.

description: French cruller is so delicious here! It is so light and fluffy. The shop itself has a very simple layout. There are a few seats and the staff is super friendly. I was able to chat with the owner and found out he bakes the donuts himself during the AM before the store opens. He is a relatively young man and I'm surprised how much dedication he has put into his business. I'm excited to see how this small business will develop!
author: country g.

description: Great little shop in the sunset. They get creative with their donuts and the owner is very nice. Be sure to get there early so you have your pick of all the donuts.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: I found my new favorite donut shop! Finally,  decent donut shop in the Sunset! I needed to find a donut shop but choices are very limited. Oh my goodness, this place is awesome. So many donut options, and they're super fresh because they're made on site.  I decided to go with a dozen donut holes, a strawberry sprinkle cake donut for my little girl and for me, I had to try the maple, bacon raised donut. It was all so yummy and fresh. I have a feeling I'll be making some random excuse to go back and eat more donuts.
author: Jennifer M.

description: i love donuts!! would have a donut everyday. haha. i had stopped for about two months. 2 months without donuts. untill i found this olace and saw they have bacon maple donuts! i had to brake my streak and have a donut.... but they were all out of bacon maple donuts.... tbe lady who helped us was very nice and informed me i could always call in the morning and reserve one... i definitely want to come back and try them out!
author: Linda P.

description: This is my go to donut shop when I want to indulge myself. Twisted offers high quality donuts with traditional and unique flavors. The yeast donuts are so soft and fluffy; you can see the high rise ring around the center of the donut so you know it's going to be tender and delicious. The cake donuts are hands down the best cake donuts I've ever eaten. They are moist, dense, and not greasy; my favorite is the blueberry cake donut. I love that it's a mom and pop shop; the customer service is always excellent and the owner always throws in a free donut or donut holes in my order. I hope people will enjoy donuts from this cute little shop for years to come.
author: Sarah Y.

description: This place is awesome and the lady who works there is so nice! Doughnuts are always fresh and super tasty!!!!
author: Lorin D.

description: This is a nice addition to the neighborhood.  My wife and I stopped in yesterday and had a friendly chat with the woman working there.  Unfortunately for me they don't appear to have vegan donuts or pastries, but it was probably unrealistic to hope otherwise.  Pleasant place to sit and have tea, however.
author: David A.

description: Neighborhood spot run by a neighborhood family. Clean, friendly and donuts. It's nice to have something like this on Noriega.
author: J C.

description: nice and clean. awesome service. best maple bacon donut i've had thus far. blueberry donut holes and the captain crunch donut were yummy too.
author: Marquesa V.

description: Bomb/chill new donut place. Freshly prepared donuts n coffee. Cinnamon roll and sprinkles donuts were my fav
author: Wats C.

description: Love Twisted donuts. We got the Halloween special which was a maple bacon donut & it was amazing. Croissants are great as well. Very friendly owners!
author: Hope C.

description: Been excited waiting for this place to open, and was really hoping it would be great.  Staff are very nice and friendly.  Unfortunately their donuts are kind of flavorless - maybe they need more sugar or a pinch of salt in the dough. They're missing something, and even though I live nearby I'm not feeling tempted to go back.
author: Ritch G.

description: The doughnuts here are absolutely out of this world. At 6:30 am they are super fresh and call my name. They look so pretty in the display case and taste delish! A great place for doughnuts in S,F. and Sunset.
author: Debi L.

description: love this place! been waiting for it to open for weeks! great donuts and coffee, and the owner and staff are all extremely friendly. i will definitely be coming here often :D
author: Mckenzie C.

description: I am really happy that we finally have a great donut shop in our neighborhood.  I have taken Twisted donuts to work on a couple of occasions, and people rave about the maple-bacon donuts.  The owners and people who work there are super-nice, and the place is impeccably clean.  I was sad when All Star on Chestnut announced it was going out of business, but with Twisted now open, I just have to walk down the street for great donuts.
author: Ted K.

description: Twisted Donuts & Coffee delivers the spice and creativity in scrumptious donuts and dark, well roasted coffee that the Sunset has longed for.  I love this place.
author: James D.

description: Great prices and a great new addition to the neighborhood! Fresh and yummy doughnuts, I could eat a dozen by myself!
author: Corinne S.

description: Was driving down Noriega St today when my eye caught a sign for Twisted Donuts, my kid and I looked at each other and knew we had to check it out, we love donuts. Twisted Donuts have delicious, fresh tasting donuts. Maple and Bacon very good better than Dynamos and equal to Voodoo. We also tried 5 other flavors and they all were delicious and fresh tasting which was surprising since we went in almost at closing. The people behind the counter were very friendly and helpful. We will be repeat customers and pray that they will be around for years to come .
author: G K.

description: Clean, fresh, bright.... Clean, DoNUTS! Go nuts! have at it, donut Hole-in da wall in outer sunset, gotta love it. Check
author: SForiginal T.

description: Arrived at Twisted Donuts today just after 9 a.m. The shop was empty, other than the one patron sipping coffee at a table. The woman behind the counter greeted me with a smile as I laid eyes upon the glass case of donut delight. There were plenty of options to pick from, from old fashioned and pink frosted with sprinkles, to cake and glazed every which way. After what seemed like an eternity of indecisiveness, I ordered one each of the maple bacon and glazed twist donuts, and the woman threw in an apple fritter for free. Two donuts and a medium coffee for $5.75. The donuts were fresh, light, and palate pleasing. My only gripe was that the credit card machine was not yet active (though the woman noted they would eventually accept cards), so cash was the only option. Otherwise, no complaints from me. A nice space and decor, good service, good eats, and an overall nice addition to the area. I'll be back.
author: T S.

description: today was my first time in this lovely donut & coffee shop.  wow, i was  very pleasantly surprised.  something different in the neighborhood which i totally appreciate since i love diversity!  jenny greeted me and she was super friendly and had me try some donut samples.  later on, i met wilson.  very friendly staff and super clean!  i ended up ordering the turkey, cheese, and jalapeno pastry.   super yummy!  went perfectly with a cup of hazelnut coffee.  wowzers!  looking forward to my next visit!  will definitely be telling folks about this gem of a place.
author: Yan K.
